As a Field Service Engineer, you’ll work in our state-of-the-art facility and at customer sites around the globe, where you are the face of Applied Materials and an integral part of a vibrant and diverse team. We train our Field Service Engineers to create and support the technology that the world relies on to manufacture semiconductor chips and related materials, every day. You’ll work beside global customers to install, maintain and upgrade their Applied Materials equipment, delivering world-class support for multimillion-dollar production systems. You will: Assist senior engineers with installing leading-edge customer equipment, performing scheduled preventative maintenance and corrective maintenance, and upgrading equipment Follow procedures you learn during your training, as well as published task plans, to test equipment and to diagnose and resolve technical problems Complete required job documentation, safety training and procedures for processing parts Professionally represent Applied Materials to the customer, using your “customer first” mindset Satisfy the company’s and customer’s on-site requirements, including safety, environmental and COVID-19 guidelines You’ll need: A high school diploma or equivalent An associate degree in electronics or engineering technologies, or equivalent work experience, or completion of military technical training and field experience Ability to read electrical and mechanical schematics Clear and effective written/verbal communications skills, with an emphasis on documenting details Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) Basic mechanical aptitude and knowledge in any of the following: pneumatics, hydraulics, electronics, vacuum, or thermodynamics Knowledge of hand tools and proper usage, including a digital multimeter Nice to have: 2–4 years of work experience in semiconductor industry or another equipment support industry What to expect: You’ll work on rotation and in shifts so that customers have ongoing support Your job requires the ability to: lift at least 35 lbs. work in a clean room environment wearing coveralls, hood, booties, safety glasses, and gloves sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach and stretch to reach equipment when needed, and stand for extended periods of time determine differences in colors You’ll need a valid driver’s license and passport Your benefits: At Applied Materials, we care about the wellbeing of our people, and we strive to support you in ways that extend beyond your work environment. As an employee, you’ll qualify for a competitive and comprehensive total rewards and benefits package, from day one. Your benefits package will be customized for your country of residence and may include: top-tier medical, dental and vision plans; disability insurance; life insurance; retirement; paid time off; health and wellness programs; career development and mentoring; sustainability and social responsibility programs; and much more. Additionally, all employees can take advantage of our company-sponsored global programs, including our Employee Assistance Program, Travel Accident/Medical Benefits Abroad, the company’s employee stock purchase program and a subscription to wellbeing tools. We value social responsibility, too: Our worldwide “Giving” program encourages employee giving and volunteering globally, while The Applied Materials Foundation provides an employee match of up to US$3,000 per employee per year. Who we are: Applied Materials is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. We’re the brain (and the brawn) behind every new technology development—whether it’s building semiconductor chips for smartphones and computers, or the underpinnings for robotics, AI and even smart TV display screens. With 27,000 employees in 19 countries, we offer an exciting place to grow and learn alongside some of the best people you’ll ever meet. We take deep pride in our Culture of Inclusion, and we celebrate the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences that help us build stronger, more resilient teams. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we actively recruit diverse talent. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status or any other basis prohibited by law. Join us as we innovate to Make Possible a Better Future! Job Description Summary Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher-level knowledge and skills. Builds knowledge of the company, processes and customers. Solves a range of straightforward problems. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction. Job Description Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. We are actively recruiting for a Financial Analyst to join our team supporting the Semiconductor Products Group. Responsibilities: Drive ongoing spending reviews with finance and operations partners, to deliver business commitments toward goals Support consolidation and reporting related to financial close, quarterly business reviews, AOP and forecast cycles Perform required activities and analysis to complete forecast and close cycles with oversight on recurring tasks Support management in completing ad hoc reports and providing basic explanations on standard analysis Prepare Balance Sheet account reconciliations and journal certifications Help group to streamline reporting and centralizing information and analytics Support the development of top-level models for use in sizing operations or business activity in support of strategic discussions Support local/regional reporting requirements for internal / external use Qualifications 2-4 years of corporate finance experience preferred Bachelor’s degree in business/accounting/finance or related field Company Facts: Ticker: Nasdaq: AMAT Market Cap: $134.5 billion Fiscal 2020 Revenue: $17.2 billion Fiscal 2020 R&D: $2.2 billion Founded: November 10, 1967 Headquarters: Santa Clara, California Global Presence: 110 locations in 19 countries Manufacturing: China, Germany, Israel, Italy, Singapore, Switzerland, Taiwan, United States Employees: ~24,000 worldwide Patents: ~14,300 issued Fortune World’s most admired companies 2021, Top 100 Barron’s most sustainable companies 2021 Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in its workforce. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We are actively recruiting for a financial analyst role to support FP&A activities for Worldwide Operations organization. You will be responsible for all spending and budgeting related activities. These activities include but are not limited to forecasting, reporting, journal entries posting, capital budget management and execution, quarter end close and accounts reconciliation. The right candidate will know how to effectively collaborate and interact with various Business Managers and be responsible in consolidating key FP&A requirements, while delivering reporting analysis for all financial cycles. Key Responsibilities Completes detailed analysis and commentary for finance and non finance executives Develops complex modeling in support of strategic plans, business sizing and performance mgmt. Performs required activities and analysis to complete close, flash or commit with minimal oversight on recurring tasks Interacts and presents analytical findings to various stakeholders. At times, may act as a direct business partner with non finance mgmt. Key participant or lead for system integration or process improvement initiatives Systems Requirement: SAP, Advanced Excel, Tableau, Microsoft Teams, BPC, Anaplan Functional Knowledge Demonstrates conceptual and practical expertise in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines Business Expertise Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Leadership Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience; may lead small projects with manageable risks and resource requirements Problem Solving Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Impact Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies Interpersonal Skills Explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Key Responsibilities FPGA development and systems engineering to develop advanced controls and AI/ML algorithms at the processing edge. Engage with global teams to effectively translate internal customer requirements to design requirements and identify potential solutions that are optimized to operate with in constraints of the product / technology platform. Design, implementation, and test of complex FPGA's used with system on chip and heterogenous processing architectures with an emphasis on reliability and scaling. Develop IP cores and software from the ground up to take advantage of the combination of processor(s) and programmable logic. Troubleshoot variety of complex software and programmable logic problems (including familiarity with FPGA timing analysis/closure techniques). Provides risk assessment and analysis of alternate solution paths. Interfaces with internal customers for requirements analysis and schedule. Provide timely status updates and proactive communications on issues to the stakeholders. Have the ability and willingness to acquire in-depth understanding of domain and existing products (beyond software) and apply that knowledge to develop new products and to deliver enhancements/ fixes for customer requirements. Compiles data for regularly scheduled or special reports, analysis, and statements. Functional Knowledge Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering / Electronics / Electrical / Instrumentation with strong background in Industrial automation software is desirable. 5+ years of experience in product development. Proven embedded system architecture analysis as well as, solution modelling desired. Familiar with Agile CICD DevOps and development automation. RTL, Verilog, and VHDL experience; High Level Synthesis experience desired. Skilled in TCL and Python script development. Excellent analytical skills, methodical problem-solving skills and troubleshooting skills. Prior experience of working in global teams and interfacing with multiple stake holders. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and the ability to interact with extended teams spread across the globe. Self-motivated and willing to learn new skills and technologies as needed. Ability to meet objectives, goals, and deadlines with minimal supervision. Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies. jobTitle: Fusion Engineering Rotation Program (2023 Graduate Opportunity)
jobDescription: Applied Materials, Inc. is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s Definition of Winning. Join the Fusion Team in 2023! Fusion is a rotational training program within the Applied Materials Varian Semiconductor Equipment business unit located in Gloucester, MA. It is designed to attract, assimilate, grow, and retain the most talented engineers entering the industry today. During the first two years of employment, Fusion members go through a series of rotational work assignments. The rotations typically consist of three or four unique engineering departmental assignments and one manufacturing department assignment. These rotations help Fusion members and managers determine where the Fusion member will flourish in their full-time position at Applied Materials. Positions in the below areas are available for 2023. Electrical Engineer Mechanical Engineer Process Engineer Reliability Engineer Software Engineer Systems Engineer Requirements Bachelor’s or Master’s degree from an accredited institution awarded within one year of start date Fields of study preferred: Computer Science & Engineering Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Physics Software Engineering Systems Engineering Student must be in good academic standing at their university, with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or above on a 4.0 scale Flexible & adaptable mindset Thrive in results-oriented culture Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: Up to 1 Year Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

As a Systems Engineer on a gas delivery development team, you will provide critical systems analysis, specifications development, qualify solutions against requirements and innovate new solutions. Requires a BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering or Systems Engineering and 10+ years of applicable experience. The ideal candidate will have experience designing gas delivery solutions for the semiconductor equipment industry. Key Responsibilities Lead and/or develop and execute significantly complex projects having a substantial mix of electrical, mechanical, physics, algorithms and software design, which are leading edge of system functionality or technology; spearhead research and development of new technologies as appropriate; and work with Marketing to insure the meet market requirement specifications (MRS) is valid and attainable. Coordinate with project marketing and management to understand system requirements. Be able to chair architecture brainstorming meetings and drive the systems process to down select to a final architecture of a project level system. Use systems analysis to create a diagram in order to review specifications, influence product engineering and software to utilize system engineering concepts for new, complex designs and ongoing engineering improvements, and supervise tests. Interface with other groups to workout design, systems architecture development and integration issues. Problem identification and troubleshooting significantly complex engineering problems, which are on leading edge of technology or system functionality. Review system engineering test results and architecture development ideas. Influence and communicate change in adjusting design direction as necessary. Support System Integration during the assembly and final testing of new product designs. Work with vendors to develop new competitive products and takes business issues into consideration. Provide remote and onsite support to field support personnel as required. Functional Knowledge Regarded as the technical expert in their particular field Demonstrates in-depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline and broad knowledge of other disciplines within the function Business Expertise Anticipates business and regulatory issues; recommends product, process or service improvements Leadership Leads projects with notable risk and complexity; develops the strategy for project execution Problem Solving Solves unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business; requires conceptual and innovative thinking to develop solutions Impact Impacts the direction and resource allocation for program, project or services; works within general functional policies and industry guidelines Interpersonal Skills Communicates complex ideas, anticipates potential objections and persuades others, often at senior levels, to adopt a different point of view Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 10 - 15 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

GL Analyst – Accounts Payable Description: The GL Analyst/AP will report to the R2R Manager and has two main responsibilities: GL Account Analysis & Accounting: day to day activities supporting Balance Sheet related accounts, including Trade A/P, Accrued Receivers, Down-payments, and AP Cash related accounts. This includes recording and reviewing Journal Entries, Account Reconciliations, Balance Sheet Review preparation, SOX control submissions, management of AP unclaimed cash process. This challenging role is best suited to an individual who can work as a team or individually on multiple projects simultaneously. Process Lead & Improvement initiator: ownership of and management of Concur Interface, management of AP unclaimed cash, emphasis on electronic payments & receipts to move away from manual check payments and monthly review of AP master data vs Payroll data. In both cases there will be room and a necessity to improve areas with process change and use of automation tools such as RPA, Smart Close, or other. This role will also be in close collaboration with other North America Global Shared Services orgs such as Employee Spend Management, Accounts Payable team, AP Disbursements, and our off-shore business process outsource provider. Other internal collaborations will include workings will be with Internal Audit, Corporate Tax and Manufacturing Finance teams. Summary of Key Responsibilities: AP Balance Sheet owner, including preparer of BSR requirements AP GL SME for projects, such as ERP integrations, automation projects or recon redesign etc Process Lead and owner of Concur interface recon, escheatment process, master data compare Project Management capability with strong accounting & analytical skills SOX 404 & External audit submissions Year End Certification of DeskTop Procedures with off-shore business process provider Backup responsibilities for other A2R analyst position which are Payroll centric Key Competencies: Accounting Experience – Understanding Of How Transaction Impact Financial Statements Excellent organizational, communication skills (both written & oral) Accuracy and adherence to corporate governance Ability to deal with change Demonstrates a drive for efficiency. Team player Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree with a major in Accounting with a CPA, CMA or MBA preferred Minimum 5-7 Years Of Finance Work Experience. Project Management experience on Finance projects Experience in support of audit requirements, SAP technical expertise and advanced excel skills Experience with Concur, a plus Experience with BlackLine modules of Journals, Recons, Matching and Smart Close Finance Project work Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Applied Materials, Inc. Global Logistics & Packaging Supplier Management Commodity Business Manager Summary Role/Responsbility This role requires a broad level of experience and understanding of strategic supply chain management, 3rd party logistics, warehousing best practices, transportation management, crating/packaging, contract management, reverse logistics, service parts logistics, and key supplier relationship management. This role reports directly to the Director, Global Logistics & Packaging Supplier Management and will be responsible for: Overall Ensure Cross Business Unit Collaboration Maintain Industry Awareness Develop Commodity & Supplier Strategy Own Supplier Relationship Ownership Own Supplier Capability Assessment Sourcing Adhere to the Logistics Sourcing Policy Manage Sourcing Board Commitment Authority Process RFx Planning/Process Lead Sourcing Event Teams Conduct Supplier Negotiations Manage Contracts/Rates Optimization & Management Conduct Tactical Transportation Procurement (Spot Buy) Perform / Support Global Rate Structures & Bid Analytics Supplier Management Standardize measurement of SLAs from contracts Define a globally uniform reporting standard Host Supplier Management Cadence meetings Track performance management Identify performance deficiencies Identify nonconformance in execution Collaborate internally and externally to correct performance deficiencies and nonconformance Success in this role requires the ability to effectively partner and directly (or indirectly) lead within a matrix, multi-site, global, cross functional team consisting of representatives from operations, engineering, manufacturing, legal, finance, and other internal organizations, and all levels and functions within the commodity supply base. Key requirements to ensure success in the role include specific commodity knowledge of international and domestic transportation (heavyweight air, ocean, parcel ground/air, and truckload), warehousing, crating and packaging, and other related logistics activities deemed necessary to support a World Class Global Supply Chain. This role requires research, analysis and understanding of the supply market drivers for each of the above commodities. In addition, it requires the ability to assess and anticipate sources of supply/capacity risk before they become reality, and to prepare recommendations to mitigate such risks. Experience QUALIFICATIONS Minimum 5-8 years of progressive experience in evaluating and managing new and existing suppliers with a high degree of supply chain industry experience, either through operational responsibility, consulting or sourcing. Experience delivering results within a global organization and has a comprehensive understanding of the domestic and international supply chain for transportation, warehousing, and crating/packaging operations. Lean and Six Sigma experience preferred Knowledge General knowledge of supply chain management, commodity management, procurement, materials management, contracting, manufacturing processes, business/finance, knowledge of commodity and an understanding of commodity strategies. Specific commodity knowledge of international and domestic Transportation (heavyweight air, ocean, parcel ground/air, and truckload), Warehousing, Crating & Packaging, and other related Logistics activities deemed necessary to support a World Class Global Supply Chain Skills Requires strong commercial negotiation, project management and leadership skills as well as demonstrated expertise in problem solving, change management and time management. Requires excellent interpersonal, communication (both written & verbal), and organizational skills, with the ability to analyze complex situations quickly. Proven financial and business acumen are paramount and must ensure the Global Fulfillment and Logistics organization remains a market leader by staying abreast of industry trends through participation in industry and trade associations. Requires proficiency with MS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word, Visio, etc.) Oral and written fluency in both Mandarin and English Education BA/BS business, engineering, logistics, or other related field is required MBA preferred Certification by NAPM and/or APICS preferred Other Ability to travel domestically and internationally required. #LI Qualifications Education: Associate's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Key Responsibilities: As a Global Product Manger for Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) at Applied Materials, you'll work with a small team to set the vision and direction for Applied's MES product line. You have deep understanding of manufacturing, how the MES is used within manufacturing, and the value the MES brings to manufacturers. And you have strong knowledge of the competitors in the MES space, with the ability to compare and contrast their strengths and weaknesses. You also have an affinity for collaborating with customers to understand needs and pain points, and the ability to translate those into product recommendations and roadmap requirements. You have the ability to communicate clearly and calmly during customer conversations, and the emotional intelligence to understand the customer's perspective and the underlying motivations driving their needs. You'll use these skills to build both external and internal consensus to drive Applied's MES product roadmap. You'll perform market and competitive analysis; build cost and pricing models; develop strategy to increase market growth; and coordinate with global Sales, Engineering, and Support teams in executing the strategy. You'll become a "super-user" of Applied's MES products and the go-to subject matter expert. Along the way you'll create marketing collateral, write manufacturing-related blog posts, conduct product-related webinars and user groups, speak at industry events, and travel to customer sites to build relationships and learn about customer needs. Prior experience with Applied Materials and competitors' MES products is a strong plus. *This position is remote and can be located anywhere in the US or Canada* Requirements: Minimum of 5 years product management experience, preferably in manufacturing software Hands-on manufacturing experience Strong understanding of MES and its use in manufacturing Strong understanding of manufacturing KPIs and practical experience driving their improvement Proven ability to define strategy, set goals, and drive results Strong ability to transform ambiguous requirements into a clear, focused action plan Strong collaboration and negotiation skills Strong communication and presentation skills Strong ability to work in cross-functional teams Demonstrated history of writing industry blog posts and/or industry speaking engagements MBA or equivalent experience is a strong plus Domestic and international travel required Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's Degree Years of Experience: 10 - 15 years Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 25% of the Time Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Job Summary The Global Vendor Master Operations Analyst reports to the GSS/GFS Global Vendor Master Manager. The role is primarily responsible for delivering new hardware to improve the product and conducting complicated troubleshooting of the equipment with the engineering, process, and software teams in our Engineered Optics business. Key Responsibilities Developing new hardware parts/modules for PVD (Physical Vapor Deposition) chambers, collaborating with Process, Engineering, Software, and Safety teams. Communicating process challenges with the teams and finding the hardware solution for them. Tracking the status of new hardware and product development, including logistics of parts delivery. Installing newly developed hardware in the lab chambers with the following AMAT lab protocols. Testing the hardware, analyzing the test result, and reporting it to the team with improvement suggestions. Working with the safety team to resolve any safety-related items in the product design and development phase as the highest priority. Handling complicated tool-related issues and finding resolutions to them. Conducting troubleshooting to find root causes and solutions. Summarizing and reporting the issues with potential root causes and explaining action plans to resolve the issues. Writing procedures for Best Known Methods (BKMs) to operate the new products, including Startup and Preventive maintenance (PM). Functional Knowledge Vacuum system, temperature control system, plasma-related technologies, and PVD process. Basic knowledge of electrical schematics and mechanical drawing. Business Expertise Interpret internal/external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes, or services Leadership Lead hardware development and troubleshooting, collaborating with team members considering customer requirements, internal development timeline, and risks. P Problem Solving Take ownership of resolving any hardware-related issues with new hardware and products, collaborating with all teams. Impact Impact the achievements to customer, operational, project, or service objectives; work is guided by functional policies Interpersonal Skills Communicate and discuss difficult issues, requirements, business, and risks with other teams to adopt a different point of view. Microsoft Office. Education: BS in mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, or related field. Experience: > 2 years of hands-on experience on Endura or any AMAT systems which is using plasma. Travel and Commuting: This role might have travel 10% of a working hour to suppliers, customers, and internal collaborating groups. This role is required to come to the office regularly. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree: Mechanical Engineering Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Requires specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise. Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions. Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations. May lead functional teams or projects. Job Description Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. This role under the Semiconductor Business Group (SPG) will support financial and planning activities, including business analytics at the group and business unit level for the Gross Margin Leadership Team (GMLT). The person coming into this role will collaborate across the Finance organization as well as with SPG Operations and Engineering functions. The ideal candidate needs to be comfortable with working both up and down the chain of command, using data to develop & create actionable & useful analytics, enhancing financial reporting capabilities, and completing deliverables related to regular business cycles. In addition, this person will be deeply involved in the creation and maintenance of a five year "cost book" roadmap across all major business units. Major Responsibilities Perform Cost & Gross Margin analysis across a variety of different revenue and cost elements over multiple groups & products. Drive financial modeling and analysis to support Gross Margin reporting for Finance & Operations executives. Participate in creation of five year planned "cost book" roadmap of cost improvement; lead process for updating and maintaining cost book Provide analysis and reporting requirements for key Semiconductor executive reviews including Strategy, Forecast, and Actuals. Interacts as a direct business partner with Semiconductor Operations Executives, delivering analysis and recommendations to guide operational and financial decisions Solicit and participate in projects and/or team discussions centered around improving both solution and process, including execution of those projects (UAT Testing) Create business processes and drive adoption of new tools (e.g. Blackbird) Partner with Operations, GIS and with other business areas to enable implementation of improved reporting systems and processes Key Competencies Business Acumen – business/financial concepts, processes and practices for sound decisions Business Partnering - creating a real and active partnership with both operations and management. Provide 'real time' support and analysis to add value in decision making Data Analytics - data analysis tools to sort through and analyze data to identify factors impacting performance and to gain greater insight into trends Data Gathering/Reporting - tools, techniques and processes for gathering/reporting data for measuring business results, objectives & strategies Financial Forecasting & Modeling - processes, tools, and techniques for exploring and evaluating alternative financial scenarios and results Flexibility & Adaptability - approaches, tools, and techniques for dealing with a changing environment Influencing - ability to impact decisions within and outside own organization Initiative - self-motivation, ability and drive to seek out work and accomplish goals Org Change Management – effect change in an organization; ability to manage successful transition from current to desired culture, practices, structure, and environment Problem Solving/Critical Thinking - approaches, tools, techniques for solving problems & making sound recommendations Very strong Excel skills, including modeling Data analysis tools such as Tableau or Power BI strongly encouraged Strong communication, including presentation skills Basic or intermediate accounting knowledge Education & Experience BS degree in Accounting or Finance; MBA preferred 5+ years of experience Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

jobTitle: Head of Display Service Business Unit - (M7)
jobDescription: General Profile: Head of Display Service Business Unit (SBU) in AGS SSC organization. Provides leadership to executives/managers, develops & executes strategies to achieve business objectives and accountable for SBU’s service products, financial & operational performance as guided by Applied Materials strategy and objectives. Key Responsibilities Develop Service products and capabilities to grow recurring revenue including subscription like Long Term Service Agreements, accountable for service product P&L for his or her SBU. Lead SBU annual strategic review & business planning, market penetration & competitive landscapes assessment. Key Responsibilities Analyzes business requirements or issues, converts analysis to functional specifications, and designs solutions to meet cross functional business requirements or resolve issues. Performs and documents software application configuration, prepares and executes testing scenarios and scripts (unit, integration, performance, regression, acceptance) and plans data conversions. Provides business application functional support for HR projects. Monitors specific IT systems or set of systems for availability, performance, and capabilities; reports anomalies through predefined process. Participates in evaluation and recommendation of patches, point releases, major upgrades, and new systems. Delivers projects in area of responsibility within allocated budget, scope, and timeline. May be responsible for planning and executing small to mid-size projects and/or for timely renewal of maintenance and subscription contracts. May serve as a team lead on a larger, complex project. Adheres to and guides junior staff and contingent workers to adhere to corporate procedures and methodology for project management, software application development, testing, service management, change management, RCA, and other relevant processes, standards, governance and controls. May manage execution of SOX controls and tests, and support internal and external audits. Responsible for the selection, on-boarding and off-boarding of contingent workers in a timely manner. Manages contingent worker project/task assignments and ensures work product quality. Approves contingent worker time sheets/invoices and/or SOW milestone deliverables. Detailed Responsibilities Evaluates system enhancement requests, estimates effort and cost of requests. Understands the architecture of new technologies and evaluates them based on the security and privacy IT standards of the company. Presents findings to the internal IT architectural review board. Coordinates with Human Resources teams to implement solutions. Provides guidance on system functionalities and limitations for applications like Workday, Saba, Hadoop and ServiceNow. Supports system upgrade activities and annual program rollouts (performance evaluation, rewards focal, ESPP enrollment, etc.). Manages HR projects and ensures compliance with corporate project methodology. Requirements 3-5 years project management experience, Agile or PMP certification preferred. 4-7 years hands-on business process configuration experience with Workday modules like HCM, Talent, Recruiting is mandatory. Hands on experience building Workday reports, integrations and webservices. Understands Workday security features and controls, knowledge of SOX and data privacy regulations. Experience working with diverse HR related cloud applications (e.g. benefits, training content providers) and an understanding of how these integrate with core HR systems such as Workday and Saba. Previous experience with Saba and/or ServiceNow is preferred. Must possess HR functional knowledge and understand HR business processes. Ability to holistically understand internal and external applications and how they integrate with each other. Ability to perceive and understand business context in which applications are used. Experience working with business stakeholders to gather requirements and support full life-cycle configurations and integrations. Experience using other data analytics and reporting applications such as Hadoop or Tableau is preferred Ability to communication appropriately to multiple levels in the organization, including customers, peers, executives, and upper management. Must be confident and comfortable presenting in front of peers and customers. Must possess excellent English communications – both verbal and written. Analytical team player, able to learn quickly, comfortable working within a matrix management environment. Demonstrates conceptual and practical expertise in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines. Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market. Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience; may lead small to medium sized projects with manageable risks and resource requirements. Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information. Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies. Ability to explain complex, difficult, or sensitive information to others; works to build consensus. Job Description Summary: Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher-level knowledge and skills. Builds knowledge of the company, processes, and customers. Solves a range of straightforward problems. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction. Job Description: Applied Materials is shaping future tech trends by turning breakthrough ideas into reality. Our expertise in materials engineering is the foundation that computers, mobile devices, and flat panel displays — products touched daily by billions of people all over the world — are built on. Join us and become a part of the next wave of engineering that makes possible AI/ML, big data, autonomous vehicles, AR/VR, IoT and more. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. In the Office of the CTO, we are focused on bringing Applied Materials innovations to new and adjacent markets. Our Engineered Optics team is creating new super thin (sub-micron) optical surfaces based on nanometer-sized structures on transparent substrates (known as “metasurface based optics” or “flat optics”), which manipulate light in the deep sub wavelength domain and enable previously impossible capabilities. These components will be the most fundamental change in optics in hundreds of years and could be deployed in AR/VR devices, cameras, projectors, sensors, and a host of yet to be imagined opportunities — there is endless potential. Our dedicated and talented team is working to perfect this new technology. If you’re an entrepreneurial-oriented, enthusiastic engineer who is willing to learn and challenge yourself in creating cutting-edge technology to revolutionize the field of optics — we want you to be a part of our team. We are actively recruiting an Industrial Engineer within our Office of the CTO. Key Responsibilities: Manages and participates in complex Industrial Engineering related projects and programs to improve productivity and efficiency. Participate in productivity improvement studies such as cycle time reduction and increasing fab throughput and implementation in related to effective and efficient use of assets and production processes. May provide cost analysis and return on investment calculations associated with project selection. Use Industrial Engineering techniques such as time studies, value stream analysis, business process re-engineering, six sigma and lean to analyze and quantify and improve fab’s cycle time, throughput, and tool output improvement opportunities Performs Methods Engineering analysis including data analytics, simulation, and time and motion studies, recommends manufacturing line improvements Calculates and maintains capacity data for materials processing, people, space, and equipment associated with production. Provides guidance to manufacturing and logistics related to effective and efficient use of assets and production processes. Run what-if scenarios for tactical and strategic planning needs Use Applied Materials software (Simulation and other propriety applications) to develop models to automate the process of data analytics Develop and implement fab models for cost, capacity, staffing and simulation Leads in I.E. projects and programs within areas of responsibility. Assists in the implementation of these projects into business with quality tools, supporting processes and ongoing measures for success. Provides cost analysis and return on investment calculations associated with project selection. Leads ergonomics / human factors evaluations, recommends, and implements improvements to work area designs. Develops and implements manufacturing facility design of plant layout, material handling systems, material staging and warehousing as desired. Serves as a role model and sets the example, whose behavior is emulated by other engineering team members. (Safe behavior, follow proper protocols and procedures, including core values). Establishes standards and procedures for multiple functions. Functional Knowledge: Regarded as the technical expert in their field Demonstrates in-depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline and broad knowledge of other disciplines within the function Business Expertise: Anticipates business and regulatory issues; recommends product, process, or service improvements Leadership: Leads projects with notable risk and complexity; develops the strategy for project execution Problem Solving: Solves unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business; requires conceptual and innovative thinking to develop solutions Impact: Impacts the direction and resource allocation for program, project or services; works within general functional policies and industry guidelines Interpersonal Skills: Communicates complex ideas, anticipates potential objections and persuades others, often at senior levels, to adopt a different point of view #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. The individual needs to be a team player and be able to work independently. The role will require the individual to present to senior management on several occasions and will be directly accountable for all I&W accuracy. Designs, develops, and evaluates complex, specialized technical training materials, assessments and programs for a variety of curriculum, classroom and interactive formats, by employing a systematic instructional methodology. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Include The Following. Applies expert knowledge of educational principles, methods, and thinking to solve critical instructional design problems to evaluate and design learner-centered, performance-based training materials in multiple modalities, including classroom, interactive eLearning modules, videos, job aids, facilitator guides, and other instructional media to support technical curriculum. Works with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and others across the organization to create accurate, measurable, outcome-based training curriculum with engaging learning activities and compelling course content that enhances retention and the knowledge/skill transfer in classroom and online delivery. Develops scalable solutions to ensure all training programs are consistent and ready for a global audience Writes task-based assessments that measure learning objectives. Works collaboratively and effectively with others to promote innovative approaches and enhance productivity related to curriculum development. Learns complex technologies and tols rapidly to "hit the ground running" in the development of technical training material. Acquires the latest industry best practices and apply those to the workplace. Demonstrated experience designing instructional solutions, collateral, eLearning and self-directed learning modules, performance support aids, online tutorials and other training materials. Highly organized and able to thrive in a deadline-oriented environment; a passionate learner and self-starter, comfortable owning projects and must have a ‘learner-focused’ mindset in a rapidly changing environment Ability to work with minimal supervision in a fast-paced, high-tech environment. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills; ability to work cross-functionally with a global team to execute multiple project schedules. Technical acumen with experience working in a high-tech engineering environment a plus. Candidates will be expected to provide a portfolio of their instructional design work. Key Responsibilities Responsible for full system integration in order to meet the system’s specification, on time delivery and quality results until end of installation while managing both the technical and operational aspects of the tool’s integration process Tests and troubleshoots modules and fully integrates systems. Performs in-house customer acceptance tests. Travels to customer sites to install and support tools. Establish and maintain effective relationships with customers and gain their trust and respect. Follow and complete documentation procedures and forms of semiconductor manufacturing equipment. Pursue and develop procedural, safety and process improvements. Identify problems and resolve problems as an individual or as a team. Evaluate System quality, performance and configuration issues. Resolve problems. Methods not always established, but where established, are often complex and difficult to follow. Duties may vary continuously. Assignments require solution of difficult problems by application of technical knowledge. jobTitle: IT Application Solution Management - Senior Functional Analyst IV (B4) - FX-99
jobDescription: Be Part of a Recognized IT Organization Consistently ranked among Computerworld’s 100 Best Places to Work in IT, Applied Material’s Global Information Services (GIS) organization offers an exciting place for its employees to succeed. Within GIS, you will gain opportunities to constantly learn new and varied technologies, expand on your skills and experience, engage in development and leadership programs, and get recognition for contributing to the Company’s and our customers’ success. We are looking for a motivated and experienced candidate to join the IT team supporting the SAP Finance Domain. The ideal candidate is an individual who initially worked on the business side at one time, has SAP Finance functional experience within IT, working knowledge of other Finance-related systems such as Concur, Taulia, and Blackline, and has progressively taken on additional projects responsibilities during their career. Required: 12 years or more of broad ECC 6.0 FI-CO experience, including full lifecycle project implementations (both large and small), SAP upgrades and continuous improvement projects 5 years or more SAP Accounts Payable (FI-AP and MM-LIV) in-depth application + configuration experience, including vendor master setup, automatic payments, electronic bank statement (EBS) setup, advance payments, input tax, withholding tax, evaluated receipt settlement invoicing (ERS), vendor managed inventory (VMI), intercompany stock transfer processing (ICTO) and experience working with bank interfaces 5 years or more SAP ECC 6.0 New GL experience including profit centers & hierarchy configuration & maintenance, financial operations processes and concepts, currency revaluation & translation, document splitting, non-leading ledger, substitutions / validations, functional area usage, financial close and consolidations, intercompany processing, account determination, internal order settlement, US and/or regional requirements. Experience and knowledge in Financial Accounting and Financial Reporting process, including financial close 3 years or more working experience with ECC 6.0 FI-FA, and associated submodule integration. Relevant areas include Fixed Asset accounting processes surrounding capital expenditures, chart of depreciation, asset classes, depreciation area, depreciation keys, account determination, internal order settlement, capitalization of CIP projects, intracompany and intercompany transfers, asset life cycle management (acquisition, management, deployment and retirement), legacy asset transfer and its prerequisite configuration, FA-GL reconciliation, fixed asset period/year end closing tasks. Integration experience working with upstream Materials Management processes such as Purchasing, Logistics and Account Determination; understanding of Procure-to-Pay process Experience writing functional specifications for interfaces and custom programs/reports, working with technical programmer to analyze defects and propose solutions Must have experience promoting changes to production and associated methodology, including writing and executing test plans Must be highly analytical: can breakdown issues, systemically think through an issue, and identify root cause Ability to learn quickly and must be a team player Must be self-starter and proactive, ability to work independently including managing deliverables/tickets, prioritize and multi-task with minimal guidance Must have strong organizational skills and eagerness to drive deliverables/tickets to closure Must possess excellent English verbal and written skills: active listener and have ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions to different groups within the company (IT and business) Strongly Preferred: Experience working with Sovos / Taxware for US sales & use tax calculations Experience with 3rd party tools using EDI/IDOC/ALE/BAPI/RFC/Connectors Functional knowledge of MDG and Dynpro forms Working knowledge and experience of Business Intelligence, including experience with writing specs for BI reports, validating and testing of BI/BO Reports Working experience on the intercompany process. Proficient with MS Office suite: MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, MS Word, etc. Experience working with integrations to external 3rd party applications such as Concur, Taulia, Fieldglass, etc. Nice to Have: Functional experience with SAP security roles and troubleshooting access issues Self-sufficient in debugging ABAP programs Knowledge and/or work experience with SAP HR, especially integration with vendor master SAP certification (note: certification number may be verified) Knowledge in new Asset Accounting Experience in BCS or Group Reporting Knowledge and/or training in S4 Hana Key Responsibilities Negotiate with customers to design solutions to address complex cross functional needs. Field Service Engineer (C1) If you like to troubleshoot hardware, solve complex problems and make equipment work better, this is the role for you. As a Field Service Engineer, you’ll work in our state-of-the-art facility and at customer sites around the globe, where you are the face of Applied Materials and an integral part of a vibrant and diverse team. We train our Field Service Engineers to create and support the technology that the world relies on to manufacture semiconductor chips and related materials, every day. You’ll work beside global customers to install, maintain and upgrade their Applied Materials equipment, delivering world-class support for multimillion-dollar production systems. You will: Assist senior engineers with installing leading-edge customer equipment, performing scheduled preventative maintenance and corrective maintenance, and upgrading equipment Follow procedures you learn during your training, as well as published task plans, to test equipment and to diagnose and resolve technical problems Complete required job documentation, safety training and procedures for processing parts Professionally represent Applied Materials to the customer, using your “customer first” mindset Satisfy the company’s and customer’s on-site requirements, including safety, environmental and COVID-19 guidelines You’ll need: A high school diploma or equivalent An associate degree in electronics or engineering technologies, or completion of military technical training and field experience A willingness to learn how to read and interpret electrical and mechanical schematics Clear and effective written/verbal communications skills, with an emphasis on documenting details Proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) Basic mechanical aptitude and knowledge in any of the following: pneumatics, hydraulics, electronics, vacuum, or thermodynamics Knowledge of hand tools and proper usage, including a digital multimeter Nice to have: 1–2 years of work experience in customer/field support What to expect: You’ll work on rotation and in shifts so that customers have ongoing support You may be asked to travel to customer sites Your job requires the ability to: lift at least 35 lbs. work in a clean room environment wearing coveralls, hood, booties, safety glasses, and gloves sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach and stretch to reach equipment when needed, and stand for extended periods of time determine differences in colors You’ll need a valid driver’s license and passport Your benefits: At Applied Materials, we care about the wellbeing of our people, and we strive to support you in ways that extend beyond your work environment. As an employee, you’ll qualify for a competitive and comprehensive total rewards and benefits package, from day one. Your benefits package will be customized for your country of residence and may include: top-tier medical, dental and vision plans; disability insurance; life insurance; retirement; paid time off; health and wellness programs; career development and mentoring; sustainability and social responsibility programs; and much more. Additionally, all employees can take advantage of our company-sponsored global programs, including our Employee Assistance Program, Travel Accident/Medical Benefits Abroad, the company’s employee stock purchase program and a subscription to wellbeing tools. We value social responsibility, too: Our worldwide “Giving” program encourages employee giving and volunteering globally, while The Applied Materials Foundation provides an employee match of up to US$3,000 per employee per year. Who we are: Applied Materials is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. We’re the brain (and the brawn) behind every new technology development—whether it’s building semiconductor chips for smartphones and computers, or the underpinnings for robotics, AI and even smart TV display screens. With 27,000 employees in 19 countries, we offer an exciting place to grow and learn alongside some of the best people you’ll ever meet. We take deep pride in our Culture of Inclusion, and we celebrate the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences that help us build stronger, more resilient teams. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we actively recruit diverse talent. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status or any other basis prohibited by law. Join us as we innovate to Make Possible a Better Future! > 50% trav Qualifications Education: Associate's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

jobTitle: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, Technical Continuous Improvement Expert E5
jobDescription: Role Summary Applied Materials is seeking a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt who will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing continuous improvement projects & programs across a globally matrixed and cross-functional business environment. We are looking for a hands-on expert with strong technical competencies in continuous improvement, statistical toolset, DMAIC, and Lean. Key Responsibilities Drive Continuous Improvement methods to achieve breakthrough improvements in performance metrics in in manufacturing and transactional business areas. Understand data trends and drive quantified results by designing and deploying analytical systems and processes. Drive optimization of the Value Stream by elimination of waste and making flow improvements across or within manufacturing, field service and logistics operations. Facilitate groups through process mapping, root cause analysis, brainstorming and project planning. Lead Kaizen Events and LSS Black Belt level projects within and across operations to optimize performance. Coach and oversee successful completion of process improvement projects using LSS methodology. Train, mentor and coach Champions and Green Belts in the use of Six Sigma tools and methodology to ensure timely completion of projects with expected client results. Employ project management skills related to overall project tracking, deliverables management, action item tracking, meeting minutes, team communications, and presentations. Keep stakeholders apprised of project status and defined deliverables. Change agent responsible to drive Continuous Improvement projects in complex cross-functional environment. Comply with all IP guidelines. Comply with all safety procedures and consistently demonstrate safety as a value. Functional Knowledge Direct experience with demonstrated success and financial results leading Six Sigma projects in an operations environment. Technical expertise of Six Sigma tools and methodologies including DMAIC, DFSS and Lean. Effective change agent able to implement strategic initiatives in an organization. Effective project management skills and ability to influence senior management. Functional understanding of core Logistics and Supply Chain functions. Business Expertise Utilize benchmarking to identify best practices, both internal and external to the organization. Comfortable presenting findings and recommendations to senior management. Semiconductor industry experience preferred. Logistics & Supply Chain experience preferred. Leadership Ability to lead and influence others within a matrix organization. Lead strategic projects while managing risk and resource requirements. Ability to effectively coach and mentor Process Owners, Champions and Green Belts. Resolves obstacles/roadblocks, serves as a sounding board for problem resolution. Problem Solving Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information. Impact Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies. Interpersonal Skills Explains difficult or sensitive information in an easy-to-understand manner; works to build consensus. Excellent interpersonal/communication and presentation skills. Adept at observing, assessing and helping team members recognize areas for development. Develops strong rapport with those they mentor. Qualifications Education Bachelor's Degree required (Manufacturing/Supply Chain/Logistics) Master’s Degree preferred Additional Qualifications Black Belt certification required Years Of Experience 10+ Years professional experience required 5+ Years of Continuous Improvement experience required 5+ Years in a related Logistic field required Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 10 - 15 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 25% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Applied Materials is shaping future tech trends by turning breakthrough ideas into reality. Our expertise in materials engineering is the foundation that computers, mobile devices and flat panel displays — products touched daily by billions of people all over the world — are built on. Join us and become a part of the next wave of engineering that makes possible AI/ML, big data, autonomous vehicles, AR/VR, IoT and more. In the Office of the CTO, we are focused on bringing Applied Materials innovations to new and adjacent markets. Our Engineered Optics team is creating new super thin (sub micron) optical surfaces based on nanometer-sized structures on transparent substrates (known as “metasurface based optics” or “flat optics”), which manipulate light in the deep sub wavelength domain and enable previously impossible capabilities. These components will be the most fundamental change in optics in hundreds of years and could be deployed in AR/VR devices, cameras, projectors, sensors, and a host of yet to be imagined opportunities — there is endless potential. Our dedicated and talented team is working to perfect this new technology. If you’re an entrepreneurial-oriented, enthusiastic engineer who is willing to learn and challenge yourself in creating cutting-edge technology to revolutionize the field of optics — we want you to be a part of our team. We are seeking a full-time Equipment Engineering Technician with 2 + years of experience working on LITHOGRAPHY equipment, e.g. litho tracks and scanners. Key Responsibilities Perform periodic and corrective maintenance on litho equipment according to equipment manufacturer recommendations Performs complex electro-mechanical technical functions and activities such as design, test, checkout, fabrication, modification, troubleshooting and assembly of electronics and electro-mechanical systems, experimental design circuitry, prototype models, specialized test equipment, tools and test fixtures. Tests and troubleshoots system level and component level problems in electrical and mechanical systems and sub-systems with minimal supervision. Assignments require solution of difficult problems by application of technical knowledge. May perform more complicated or complex new system and NPI installations and field upgrades. May work from limited or no documentation. Investigates, compiles data, documents and recommends changes using applicable reporting process to enhance product performance. Compiles logbooks and test procedures documentation utilizing good writing skills. Assists in revising, developing and implementing documented procedures. Writes complex technical reports and test procedures. Performs mechanical, electrical, pneumatic & vacuum and process testing on AMAT platforms to Engineering and Manufacturing documentation and specifications. Observes all safety standards. Maintains a secure, safe, clean and healthy work environment. Attends required health and safety training and follows safety and security policies, procedures and practices. Promptly reports accidents, injuries, safety hazards, or emergencies to supervisor or Safety dept. Follows operating instructions, uses protective equipment when required, and uses equipment and materials properly. Actively strives to prevent accidents and injuries. Requires full understanding of the company's manufacturing and/or engineering processes, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interface across departmental/functional lines. Provides management with technical input in order to correct problems both at the system level and in the manufacturing process. Provides training to lower level Engineering Technicians. Recognized as technical resource for a particular platform or product. Highly proficient at troubleshooting and resolving issues. Effective at providing standard work and workmanship skills training. Works closely with Engineering in the development of procedures and documentation for NPI. May serve as a "Quality Lead". Functional Knowledge Lithography equipment experience is required Has developed advanced specialized expertise within a analytical/scientific area to perform the most complex work Business Expertise Has a good understanding of how related teams coordinate their efforts and resources to achieve objectives Leadership May act as a lead for the team, may allocate work and provide subject matter guidance to more junior team members Problem Solving Exercises judgment, based on previous experience, practices and precedents, to identify and solve problems that arise with little or no precedent Impact Impacts the effectiveness of own team and closely related teams Interpersonal Skills Exchanges ideas and information effectively; uses tact and diplomacy when dealing with others #LI Qualifications Education: Associate's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Key Responsibilities Manages operations with multiple outsourced logistics providers and internal organization such as Planning, Purchasing and Business Management Operations. Oversee crating and packaging operations as well as inventory validations provided by the warehouse. Manages methodologies and processes across product types to ensure a unified process is established and maintained. Generate necessary documentation, including status reports, operation review input, and parts availability. Supervise finished goods inventory Work directly with continuous improvement teams to streamline processes and make team more efficient as well as implement corrective actions for 6S related items. Determines staffing requirements, ensures effective recruitment, training, and retention of key staff to enable staff development. Administers company policies, including yearly performance review, quarterly check ins, and safety principles. Business Expertise Receives assignments in the form of objectives with goals and the process by which to meet goals. Recommends changes to unit or sub-unit policies. Management reviews work to measure meeting of objectives Leadership Provides direction to employees according to established policies and management guidance. Administers company policies that directly affect subordinate employees Problem Solving Exercises judgment within defined procedures and policies to determine appropriate action. Implement corrective actions that are sustainable. Interpersonal Skills Interaction normally requires the ability to gain cooperation of others, conducting presentations of technical information concerning specific projects or schedules. Technical Skills (Not Mandatory) SAP ERP software Microsoft (Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Exc.) Key Responsibilities Can safely operate a CNC Mill or CNC Lathe performing basic operations in producing prototype parts, production parts, modifications and repairs to existing parts and assemblies, and/or fabricating parts from steels, stainless steels, aluminum, plastics and other non-metals. Supports in-house customers, such as manufacturing, engineering, business units, direct/indirect materials, and facilities. Portrays a customer service approach. Interfaces effectively and courteously with customers. Utilizes Work Orders, blueprints, sketches, written and verbal instructions to determine machining process, procedures, tooling and fixtures requirements. Performs basic machining and/or assembly tasks utilizing standard machine shop equipment, such as surface grinders, drill presses, grinders, sanders, band saws, rotary table, and/or standard band and power tools. Plans and performs basic machine set-ups. Possesses the ability to perform basic calculations, which are required to accurately calculate angles used in set-ups and machining. Makes full use of machine capacity to minimize amount of machining or number of set-ups required to product parts competitively. Performs machining operations, such as milling, turning, facing, boring, chasing single and multiple external and internal threads, drilling, grooving, reaming and chamfering. Monitor machines and verify that part dimensions conform to specifications. Performs visual and dimensional inspections to verify compliance with specifications. Uses calipers, micrometers, gauges, indicators, and other inspection tools. Performs rework as necessary. Maintains cleanliness of the work area and ensures proper handling of tools, equipment, and stock to prevent loss. Conforms to departmental safety requirements. Functional Knowledge Applies basic analytical skills or scientific methods or operational processes to perform straightforward activities Business Expertise Understands how the assigned duties relate to others in the team and how the team integrates with others Leadership Has no supervisory responsibilities Problem Solving Uses standard operating procedures or scientific methods to guide own work and solve standard problems Impact Impacts own work Interpersonal Skills Uses communication skills to exchange information Qualifications Education: Associate's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: Up to 1 Year Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Key Responsibilities Supervises employees involved in a variety of production and/or operation functions such as assembly, inspection, test, and/or final test which is related to the manufacturing of the company's capital equipment and systems (electronic, mechanical, electro-mechanical, and/or components, subassemblies and subsystems). Sets up daily team priorities, develops work schedules and assigns tasks. Responsible for developing and executing action plans and utilizing Shift Handoffs and designated operations reviews. Organize and facilitate work team meetings (examples: pre-shift, safety, etc.). Participates in development and tracking of organization performance metrics. Responsible for meeting or improving cycle time performance and other metrics. Coordinates efforts of service and/or customer groups to solicit resources tools, supplies, materials or services to meet production schedules. Responsible for eliminating safety incidents, improving equipment efficiency, and developing leadership capability and morale on a production line. Assists in training and career development; manages the performance management process. Manages the employee selection, hiring, reward and discipline processes. May participate in the development of the budget to include forecasting manpower requirements and overhead expenditures. Identifies process and quality changes designed to improve manufacturing or department capabilities. Drives Lean, Safety and Quality. Takes corrective action. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates understanding and application of guidelines, procedures and processes in own job family Business Expertise Applies understanding of how own team is impacted by upstream work of other teams Leadership Supervises day-to-day work and participates in the coaching and development of employees Problem Solving Uses judgment based on practice and precedent to resolve issues related to production schedules and daily priorities Impact Impacts the quality and timeliness of team’s results and its contribution to team or department goals Interpersonal Skills Uses tact and diplomacy to exchange information and handle sensitive issues Position requires understanding of Applied Materials global Standards of Business Conduct and compliance with these standards at all times. This includes demonstrating the highest level of ethical conduct reflecting Applied Materials' core values. Key Responsibilities Supervises employees involved in a variety of production and/or operation functions such as assembly, inspection, test, and/or final test which is related to the manufacturing of the company's capital equipment and systems, electronic, mechanical, electro-mechanical, and/or components, subassemblies and subsystems.
