Job Description Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale helps our customers – who make smartphones, supercomputers, virtual reality headsets, autonomous vehicles and more – transform their ideas into reality. Our innovations Make Possible® a Better Future. The Wet Lab Services Group (WLSG) provides internal wafer processing services, supporting the exciting development of new products. We are seeking self motivated, detail oriented individuals for our team. Members will be responsible for operating wet processing equipment and furnaces. Responsibilities Plan and schedule the work Use manufacturing execution system to perform lot scheduling and status reporting. Generate and communicate status reports as needed. Maintain communication with customers throughout the processing effort. Contact internal customers as needed. Follow through with action items and communicate progress to customers. Process the materials Closely check each submitted request to make sure that the system database has correct details. Perform lot start verification. Maintain integrity of work being processed at the furnaces and wet benches Operate wet processing equipment (Full personal protective equipment (PPE) and face shield during handling of chemicals required) Operate oxidation furnaces. Load and unload process equipment, initiate system operation and monitor status. Assess inline process quality and ensure compliance to process specifications. Inspect and sort wafers at various stages of the wet labs manufacturing processes using metrology/sorting tools such as unpatterned wafer defect inspection systems, film thickness measurement systems and other measurement equipment. Assist in running etch rate studies, trace metals analysis and metals contamination qualification studies. Package and label wafers in accordance to cleanroom protocols. Prepare materials for shipment, coordinate interplant transportation. Provide materials (wafers and other spare parts) handling and coordination for building-to-building transportation, lot tracking, and data management Monitor and support equipment and work areas Qualify equipment upon startup. Perform adjustments or minor services as needed to enable equipment performance to meet requirements. Ensure all wet benches maintain the correct levels, temperatures, and concentrations of the required chemicals Perform manual fills with single or combinations of chemicals on wet benches Provide recipe management and new recipe creation. Provide maintenance support for furnaces and, trouble shoot furnace diagnostic problems. Interact with suppliers and facilities personnel for preventative maintenance, equipment service and scheduled shutdowns Manage furnace and wet equipment consumables such as quartzware, paddles, process carriers, filters, chemicals, tanks, wands, and other materials. Manage inventory of wafers. Update consumables log and report status as required. Maintain equipment and work area cleanliness in accordance with cleanroom protocols. Prevent contamination of products and work areas. Perform safety audits. Other Mentor other employees and train new hires as required. Support overtime as needed. Other responsibilities as assigned by manager Attributes of the Ideal Candidate This position requires high attention to detail and strong desire to learn Proven ability to interface with members of various departments Solid organizational and interpersonal skills Strong written and verbal communication skills. Provides solutions to problems in situations that are atypical or infrequently occurring based on existing precedents or procedures Familiarity with cleanroom protocols Ability to work in a cleanroom garment and additional personal protective equipment, required when handling chemicals or working in designated chemical areas. Ability to handle and pour hazardous chemicals associated with semiconductor processes Familiarity with the function of various wet processing equipment is a plus. Required Skills / Knowledge Associate Degree or equivalent work experience Shifts Available First and Second Shifts, Monday - Friday (United States of America) Overtime available on Saturday and Sunday Travel < 1% Job classifications available (T1) 0-3 years of wet lab experience, ideally with a background in semiconductor chemistry and chemical mixing (T2) 3-5 years of wet lab experience with a background in semiconductor chemistry and chemical mixing (T3) 7+ years, lead operator wet lab experience with a background in semiconductor chemistry and chemical mixing (T4) 8+ years, supervisor, highly skilled technical role or equivalent experience with a background in semiconductor chemistry and chemical mixing #LI Qualifications Education: Technical Diploma Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Job Description Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. This position reports directly to the Business Unit CFO of Metals/ALD. In this role, the candidate will be expected to apply conceptual and practical financial expertise to establish and standardize business processes, address complex business problems, and drive investment decision for profitable growth. As a key finance business partner, the candidate will own and be responsible for the Development portfolio for both Metals and ALD organization as well as having Opex Management of the Metals BU. The candidate must be able to anticipate internal and/or external business challenges and actively influence management with critical analysis and sound business advice. This role collaborates with various cross-functional organizations globally and requires the ability to provide solutions to complex problems. Works independently to support a complex and growing business with a diverse set of new and existing products serving high share applications to commodity type applications. Major Responsibilities This is a dynamic role that will enable the candidate to lead the BUs financial investment portfolio analysis and Opex management in partnership with Operations. The position requires an individual who is eager to work with both BU executives and first line managers to provide valued Finance support: Interfacing with Operations to manage Opex to target and prioritizing projects. Including Capital spending plan and tracking. Lead quarterly Opex spend planning by project and align with allocation support groups. Includes Labor, Controllable, Depreciation and Allocations. Present Opex plan to Senior Management. Provide value-add participation in the quarterly update of R&D program business case NPV models (Forecasting: Revenue, COS, Opex, Cashflow). Prepared to present financial forecasts and provide financial decision support. Partner within Finance and BU to drive and implement Anaplan, SAP BPC, tableau reporting and Project Resource Management (PRM), to streamline R&D spend reporting and analysis. Comfortable with building ad-hoc Opex models for long term Strategic plan. Ensure data accuracy and help management team develop and tell the story of the business unit using that information (forecasting/budgeting, financial close, balance sheet integrity). Qualifications & Preferences Executive level communications but also aptitude to drive detailed process and data analytics to support engineering program management. Very strong Excel skills, including modeling Strong systems capabilities, preferably with Anaplan, SAP BPC, tableau and PRM Analytical and problem-solving skills Interpersonal skills to engage with partners to understand key issues, develop recommendations and implement actions to improve the business result Experience in P&L reporting and analysis Basic accounting knowledge Other valued characteristics – Assertiveness, initiative, communication, curiosity about the business, team oriented, collaborative Experience in semiconductor equipment or other manufacturing enterprises Company Facts: Ticker: Nasdaq: AMAT Fiscal 2020 Revenue: $17.2 billion Fiscal 2020 R&D: $2.2 billion Founded: November 10, 1967 Headquarters: Santa Clara, California Global Presence: 93 locations in 17 countries Manufacturing: China, Germany, Israel, Italy, Singapore, Taiwan, United States Employees: ~24,000 worldwide Patents: ~14,300 issued #LI Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Do you want to become a part of the next wave of engineering that makes possible AI/ML, big data, autonomous vehicles, AR/VR, IoT and more? Applied Materials is shaping future tech trends by turning breakthrough ideas into reality. Our expertise in materials engineering is the foundation that computers, mobile devices and flat panel displays — products touched daily by billions of people all over the world — are built on. In the Office of the CTO, we are focused on bringing Applied Materials innovations to new and adjacent markets. Our Engineered Optics team is creating new super thin (sub micron) optical surfaces based on nanometer-sized structures on transparent substrates (known as “metasurface based optics” or “flat optics”), which manipulate light in the deep sub wavelength domain and enable previously impossible capabilities. These components will be the most fundamental change in optics in hundreds of years and could be deployed in AR/VR devices, cameras, projectors, sensors, and a host of yet to be imagined opportunities — there is endless potential. We are hiring an Optical Applications Engineer to join our dedicated and talented team working to perfect this new technology. Key Responsibilities Implementation and characterization of new optical metrology products Design test plans, collect data, perform analyses, present results and conclusions to engineering teams and customers Thorough, in-depth understanding of customer technologies, processes, and critical gaps; Definition and implementation of metrology solutions addressing the gaps Interface with customers, align on technical requirements and schedules Creation of new methodologies and applications in order to optimize system performance for specific problems Deliver training to new employees Ability to work individually and in groups Ability to explain difficult or sensitive information; build consensus around ideas/implementations Evaluate new technologies, pursue innovative solutions, evaluate competitors and define new market needs. Plan and conduct test of new technologies under evaluation in the team. Execute feasibility studies of new technologies and provide results / analysis supporting the decision making process. Executes feasibility studies of complete systems / sub-systems, leveraging new technologies and design concepts. Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale helps our customers – who make smartphones, supercomputers, virtual reality headsets, autonomous vehicles and more – transform their ideas into reality. Our innovations Make Possible® a Better Future. Inside our company, we apply the idea of Make Possible as we work together. We value our people and teams who turn possibilities into reality by advancing our strategy, accomplishing great things and empowering others. We are deeply committed to fostering a Culture of Inclusion where every person knows they belong, feels empowered to bring their whole self to work, and is inspired to grow. If you’re looking for the next step in your future, consider Applied Materials. With the data explosion and new investment in semiconductors, it’s an exciting place to be. Key Responsibilities And Requirements Using Autodesk Inventor, create new designs, or modify mechanical engineering layouts/schematics and/or detailed drawings/specifications of difficult and complex scope Perform engineering analysis of difficult scope with limited or no supervision including but not limited to stress/strain modeling, vibration modeling, and thermal modeling of opto-mechanics Import and manipulate ray-trace models into CAD space to model clear aperture requirements and define opto-mechanical component design Technically lead and/or execute engineering projects, including development of key suppliers. Generate opto-mechanical specifications for optical tooling and optical subassemblies Design, development, source, and implement custom opto-mechanical tooling, fixturing, and associated processes to enable the handling, assembly and/or disassembly of parts, components, sub-assemblies and final assemblies. Create written, concise, highly detailed procedures for assembling and testing opto-mechanics Problem identification and troubleshooting a variety of difficult opto-mechanical problems with limited or no supervision Create and present pre- and post-experimental presentations to share formally with colleagues Create and present preliminary design specification presentations, critical release design specification presentations, and share formally with colleagues Define, coordinate, perform, and document engineering test reports with limited supervision Create ISO standardized fabrication drawings for optical components such as lenses, prisms, mirrors, beam splitters, windows, and related optical thin-film coatings Specify, create, and review engineering documentation from concept to vendor selection, vendor qualification, and the production release process Implement new and innovative opto-mechanical concepts for a variety of complex opto-mechanical tooling and products Create Python code, or equivalent, to control precision motion control and data acquisition systems for aligning and measuring optical systems In a class 1000 cleanroom environment, routinely build precision opto-mechanical assemblies while performing optical measurements to demonstrate key specifications are met Use and interpret phase-measuring interferometers Use and interpret low-coherence distance measuring interferometers, autocollimators, micrometers, indicators, and dial calipers High level of manual dexterity for handling small and fragile opto-mechanical components with confidence and competency using standard hand tools Follow all required corporate environmental health and safety regulations Operate visible and ultraviolet lasers while exercising required corporate CLASS IV laser safety procedures #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Not Specified Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We are working on exciting projects, connecting materials to systems, to drive new innovations that enable the growth of Artificial Intelligence. You will have the opportunity to explore process and design innovations and impact on PCBs and Packages, to significantly improve system Power, Performance and Area. In this role, in addition to hands-on development, you will drive high visibility projects between Design, Applied’s AI and Package Process Development teams. develops the strategy for project execution Impacts the direction and resource allocation for program, project or services; works within general functional policies and industry guidelines Qualifications: BS/MS/PhD in Electrical or Computer Engineering or related field with 10+ years of package design and Signal/Power Integrity analysis experience Strong experience in IC package, PCB selection, design, and layout Strong experience in pinmap optimization of optimal PCB design, IO + PKG + PCB SI/PI modeling, co-simulation and analysis Strong knowledge in 3D/2D EM simulation tool, electromagnetic theory and transmission line theory Strong knowledge of die floor planning, IO placement, and bump placement Strong knowledge of Chip, Package and PCB co-design methodology Familiar with assembly and substrate manufacturing process Familiar with trade-offs among package cost, technologies, design, performance, power, and thermal requirements Familiar with PCB stack-up and breakout strategy Experience in Python, MATLAB, Perl and other scripting language is a plus Experience with various modeling and simulation tools (HFSS, SIWave, ADS, SiSoft QSI/QCD, Cadence Sigrity PowerSI, ExtractIM, Redhawk) Knowledge of reliability test methods and qual procedure; Key Responsibilities Employees may specialize in planning activities involving production control, inventory control, process control, or shop floor control / Material Resources Planning (MRP) integrity Maintains SAP work order release schedule that provides material on-time to manufacturing and engineering. Reschedules and/or completes no-charge, all discrete jobs as required. Increases component availability at time of release by performing pre-shortage analysis. Performs work order variance analysis. Reviews MRP execution and ensures accuracy of information; reconciles supply and demand; validates master scheduling and/or PDS requirements. Reviews and ensures proper disposition of Engineering Change Orders (ECO's). Performs regular system maintenance and audits to ensure system accuracy. Participates in floor audits with Finance and resolves WIP issues. Attends production meetings and provides status on material shortage commit dates. Changes "make" level lead times in accordance with reality on the manufacturing floor. Works with engineers to manage materials for special engineering projects. May work with work centers on shop floor control activities. Inventory Control – Analyzes usage data and stock levels to order parts to satisfy service levels; maintains inventory levels per plan and expedites shortages; may forecast spare parts needs. Examines material variances, resolves problems where possible, and/or communicates more difficult problems to management. Assists in setting up new inventory systems or modifying existing systems, when necessary; assigns appropriate expediting duties to expediters. May manage obsolete inventories. Process Control – Participates in identifying root cause and corrective action from PCI reporting and metrics, drives cycle counting. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates expanded conceptual knowledge in own discipline and broadens capabilities Business Expertise Understands key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work Leadership No supervisory responsibilities but provides informal guidance to new team members Problem Solving Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience and judgment and precedents Impact Impacts quality of own work and the work of others on the team; works within guidelines and policies Interpersonal Skills Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations Desired Skills SAP Excel Smartsheet Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobDescription: Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale helps our customers – who make smartphones, supercomputers, virtual reality headsets, autonomous vehicles and more – transform their ideas into reality. Our innovations Make Possible® a Better Future. Inside our company, we apply the idea of make possible as we work together. We value our people and teams who turn possibilities into reality by advancing our strategy, accomplishing great things and empowering others. We are deeply committed to fostering a Culture of Inclusion where every person knows they belong, feels empowered to bring their whole self to work, and is inspired to grow. If you’re looking for a great place to grow your career, consider Applied Materials. With the data explosion and new investment in semiconductors, it’s an exciting place to be. Responsibilities Process Engineers work across technologies such as: Chemical Vapor Deposition, Atomic Layer Deposition, Plasma Reactive Ion Etch, Physical Vapor Deposition, Anneal and Implant. With guidance from senior teammates and an environment of continuous learning opportunities, responsibilities include: Participate in the creation of cutting-edge processes used to manufacture the most-advanced semiconductor chips, many of which are inside everyday electronic devices Design, collect data, analyze and compile reports on complex process engineering experiments Perform hardware characterization on a variety of systems Measure film properties, organize data, and interpret data Troubleshoot moderately complex problems, perform Root Cause Analysis and resolve moderately difficult process engineering issues Generate internal documentation for products, presentations and technical reports Interact with customers to resolve process engineering issues Identify, select and work with vendors and suppliers Implement new technology, products and analytical instrumentation Requirements Graduating with a Bachelor's degree in Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Physics, Nanotechnologies or related field Good academic standing with a GPA of 3.0 or above on a 4.0 scale Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience, precedents, and judgment Ability to exercise judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations Multi-disciplinary team collaboration Has an appetite to grow a career in the semiconductor industry Flexible and adaptable mindset Thrive in a results-driven culture Legally authorized to work in US without future sponsorship Considerations Previous internship or related experience in field Demonstrated leadership experience Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Key Responsibilities Troubleshoot a variety of complex problems, perform Root Cause Analysis and resolve a variety of difficult process engineering issues to improve defectivity. Generate internal and external documentation for products, presentations and technical reports. Interact with customers to resolve a variety of difficult process engineering issues/problems with limited supervision Coordinates design requirement review with appropriate engineering/scientific personnel to ensure compatibility of processing methods. Compiles and evaluates test data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications. May conceive and plan projects involving definition and selection of new concepts, equipment automation technology, and approaches in the processing or development of new or improved defects performance. Design, perform, collect data, analyze and compile reports on moderately difficult process engineering experiments; perform hardware characterization on moderately difficult systems; and investigate materials/system failures and interpret data. Measure materials (particles, film, coating, and bulk) properties and interpret data. Identify, select and work with vendors and suppliers with limited supervision. Implement new technology, products and analytical instrumentation. Develops new or modified process formulations, defines processing or handling equipment requirements and specifications, and reviews processing techniques and methods applied in the manufacture, fabrication, and evaluation of products. Involvement may begin at any step from pilot plant to full-scale manufacturing. Key Responsibilities Design, execute, collect data, analyze and compile reports on a variety of complex process engineering experiments. Data would be the form of on-wafer structural and electrical characterization as a function of tool operation and process parameters. Perform hardware characterization on a variety of complex systems. Collaborate effectively with hardware and systems engineers to improve new product performance. Troubleshoot a variety of complex problems, perform Root Cause Analysis and resolve a variety of difficult process engineering issues related to novel etch processes and equipment. Generate internal and external documentation for products, presentations and technical reports. Interact with customers to resolve a variety of process, hardware, and integration problems. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a science/engineering field, such as Physics, chemistry, materials science, electrical engineering, and chemical engineering. Advanced degree is a plus. Be knowledgeable in key semiconductor device characterization and materials analysis such as electron microscopy, thin film characterization and compositional analysis, typical electrical characterization and interpretation of the results. Have experience with silicon wafer plasma processing equipment. In particular, in-depth knowledge of plasma-etch hardware and process. Understanding of semiconductor device and process technology. Excellent analytical and communication skills. Desired Qualifications PhD in a science/engineering field, such as physics, chemistry, materials science, electrical engineering, or chemical engineering. Working experience and understanding of semiconductor manufacturing and the process integration schemes. Job Description Join a network of experts within Applied Materials FABVANTAGE team working closely with our field support organization to implement, support, and improve our Digital Preventive Maintenance (PM) offering. Function as both Project Manager and SME leading discussions with customers to understand their PM High Value Problems (HVP), propose and implement new Continuous Improvement Projects (CIP), capture learning to maximize service opportunities and implement the solutions to improve our service offering and customer KPIs. Increase equipment service support value through GtG/variability/MWBC/COO reduction and PM optimization Demonstrates & drives the deployment and sustaining of PM Engineering and Digital Tools at the customer site Drive performance improvement utilizing analytics, equipment knowledge, and continuous improvement methodologies Lead PM assessments & benchmark including PM360 and Lean Gemba Define the use of portable metrology in PM execution PM Monitoring through R365 and data analytics to support continuous improvement Knowledge & Skills: In depth knowledge of hardware on one or more areas (CVD, PVD, ETCH), experience with 2 or more technologies strongly preferred Technical expertise as demonstrated by improvement projects or field problem solving examples Vacuum theory and strong fab experience with complex vacuum systems HVM process tool in-line metrology and defect basic knowledge In-depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline and broad knowledge of other Fab Engineering disciplines Strong Project management skills Education: Bachelor's Degree Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Applied Materials, Inc. is the global leader in providing innovative equipment, services and software to enable the manufacture of advanced semiconductor, flat panel display and solar photovoltaic products. Our technologies help make innovations like smartphones, flat screen TVs and solar panels more affordable and accessible to consumers and businesses around the world. The Center of Excellence of Surface Technology and Cleaning is seeking energetic candidates who have strong technical knowledge & experience with laser optics, semiconductor equipment and critical surface modification related to material cleanliness. The successful candidate will have a passion for innovation and a strong desire to solve challenging sub10nm particle and contamination problems. She/he will work closely with engineering and manufacturing groups from internal product groups on productivity issues and new product offerings. The position is hands on and includes commercialization responsibility in addition to defining concepts and proving feasibility of novel cleaning and surface technologies that support and extend the performance specifications of Applied Materials products. Key Responsibilities: Develops material surface processes and related clean processes for chamber components Support product launching operation Maintains and characterizes optical process equipment with SPC control Performs surface characterization and failure analysis on critical parts and utilizes different analytical techniques such as SEM-EDX, LSM, TEM, ICP-MS, LPC, etc to identify root cause and derive solution Provide technical support to other teams and supply chain functions Ensure laser optical safety standards are always met. Comply with all safety policy Provide technical leadership in laser processing to the R&D, Development and Manufacturing teams Operate and maintain laser materials processing setups and procedures Develop and optimize laser processes for advanced manufacturing applications Use a variety of metrological tools to characterize processed part quality Summarize and present experimental results to team members Drive continuous improvement efforts for released processes for performance and cost/yield Qualifications Education and Skills: Bachelor's or master’s degree or PhD (Focus on Physics, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering or Material Science preferred), 3-5 Years of experience in technical roles (laser optics and analytical testing are preferred) Flexible and adaptable to new technological environment and new ideas Knowledge of laser optics and associated software control systems Computer skills: MS Office (Excel, Word, PPT, JMP, CAD, LabView or similar, Modeling, SPC, DOE, ANOVA) Capable to handle 30lb parts Process chamber hardware failure analysis experience is desirable Understanding of optical physics fundamentals and their applications to laser materials processing, with a minimum of 2 years of experience in laser processing. Knowledge of laser hardware and related optical components with emphasis on solid state lasers Strong hands-on skills in the alignment, test, and characterization of optical devices and laser systems Experience with semiconductor materials Experience with design for high-volume manufacturing and design for test, and design for automation is preferred Proficiency in the understanding of experimental data Track record of successful transfer of design to manufacturing Problem Solving Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Impact Impacts a range of customer, engineering, operations, supplier activities within own team and other related teams Interpersonal Skills Explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobTitle: Process Engineer (Master's Level) - Early in Career Opportunity!
jobDescription: Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale helps our customers – who make smartphones, supercomputers, virtual reality headsets, autonomous vehicles and more – transform their ideas into reality. Our innovations Make Possible® a Better Future. Inside our company, we apply the idea of make possible as we work together. We value our people and teams who turn possibilities into reality by advancing our strategy, accomplishing great things and empowering others. We are deeply committed to fostering a Culture of Inclusion where every person knows they belong, feels empowered to bring their whole self to work, and is inspired to grow. If you’re looking for a great place to grow your career, consider Applied Materials. With the data explosion and new investment in semiconductors, it’s an exciting place to be. Responsibilities Process Engineers work across technologies such as: Chemical Vapor Deposition, Atomic Layer Deposition, Plasma Reactive Ion Etch, Physical Vapor Deposition, Anneal and Implant. Responsibilities include: Requirements Considerations Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Applied Materials is shaping future tech trends by turning breakthrough ideas into reality. Our expertise in materials engineering is the foundation that computers, mobile devices and flat panel displays — products touched daily by billions of people all over the world — are built on. Join us and become a part of the next wave of engineering that makes possible AI/ML, big data, autonomous vehicles, AR/VR, IoT and more. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. In the Office of the CTO, we are focused on bringing Applied Materials innovations to new and adjacent markets. Our Engineered Optics team is creating new super thin (sub micron) optical surfaces based on nanometer-sized structures on transparent substrates (known as “metasurface based optics” or “flat optics”), which manipulate light in the deep sub wavelength domain and enable previously impossible capabilities. These components will be the most fundamental change in optics in hundreds of years and could be deployed in AR/VR devices, cameras, projectors, sensors, and a host of yet to be imagined opportunities — there is endless potential. We are looking to hire a highly motivated, hands-on Process Technician to support our cutting-edge AR/VR devices. This position will be in our engineering group located in Sunnyvale, California where our dedicated and talented team is working to perfect this new technology. Key Responsibilities Prepares wafers tool for experimentation to include, examine loading wafers, loading chemicals and loading imprint replica and manual align replica. Operates nanoimprint lithography tool according to engineer pass down. Recommends performance of process system and troubleshooting. Provides recommendations to engineering. Records process conditions and experimental observations. Operates metrology tool using existing recipe. Evaluates wafers thin films, including optimization of the process recipes. Prepares graphs and tables summarizing results and analyzes data. Interface with requestors, understand their detail requirement, and communicate on results. Perform routine preventive maintenance. Identify problem put tool down and call for service. Develop and publish best known method (BKM) procedures and document best known procedure. Orders equipment and supplies, and coordinates with vendors and purchasing. Coordinates instrument repair and maintenance. Required Self-motivated, willing to learn with superior teamwork skills. Hands on experience with tool operators e.g. lithography tool, track, spin coater, hotplate. Hands on experience with wafer handling and process. Excellent Microsoft Excel skills. Excellent communication skills. Must be comfortable working in a class 100 clean room environment. Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent (required). #LI Qualifications Education: Technical Diploma Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

jobTitle: Process Support Engineer Development Program (2023 Graduate Opportunity)
jobDescription: Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale helps our customers – who make smartphones, supercomputers, virtual reality headsets, autonomous vehicles and more – transform their ideas into reality. Our innovations Make Possible a Better Future. Inside our company, we apply the idea of Make Possible as we work together. We value our people and teams who turn possibilities into reality by advancing our strategy, accomplishing great things and empowering others. We are deeply committed to fostering a Culture of Inclusion where every person knows they belong, feels empowered to bring their whole self to work, and is inspired to grow. Process Support Engineers (PSEs) play key roles necessary to complete the Product Life Cycle – from concept-to-qualification and everything in between. The PSE is customer facing, responsible for recipe optimization to maximize the performance of the designed product in support of the customer’s needs. You will partner with our globally recognized R&D teams and work directly with customers in their fabs to develop solutions that drive the semiconductor industry. As a PSE, you will play a critical role in enabling our customers’ success. You will partner with our globally recognized R&D teams while working directly with our customers in their fabs to develop solutions that power the semiconductor industry. PSEs work across our broad portfolio of technologies, including Chemical Vapor Deposition, Atomic Layer Deposition, Plasma Reactive Ion Etch, Physical Vapor Deposition, Anneal and Implant. Key Responsibilities Provide high visibility customer support through the performance of on-site installations, system diagnoses, and the service and repair of complex systems and equipment Work closely with the customer to develop leading-edge processes used to manufacture the most advanced semiconductor chips, many of which are inside everyday electronic devices Design both hypothesis experiments and design of experiments (DOE), analyze data with statistics and compile reports with high level conclusions on technically challenging process engineering experiments Troubleshoot a variety of complex problems, perform root cause analysis and resolve a variety of difficult process engineering and customer product issues Communicate with both internal stakeholders and the customer to achieve goals with a focus on building relationships and establishing trust World-Class Training Your journey with Applied begins in our Process Support Engineer Development Program, where you will experience a blended learning environment and expanded networking opportunities. With rotations in our state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities in Texas and our two R&D innovation centers – the Maydan Technology Center (MTC) in California and the Materials Engineering Technology Accelerator (META) in New York – you will gain high-level visibility into the organization and the skills to propel your career as a PSE. The PSE role is a broad, career-growth foundation. Your quick exposure to Applied Materials’ tools and technologies, internal operations and customer requirements can lead to future opportunities in technical program management, account management (sales), product and technology development, as well as field service. Qualifications Bachelor’s, Master’s and PhD degree in Materials Engineering, Chemistry, Physics or related field Good academic standing with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or above on a 4.0 scale Strong interpersonal skills with an emphasis on building trust Exercise judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Explain difficult or sensitive information and work to build consensus Able to solve problems creatively and analytically Flexible and adaptable mindset Thrive in a results-driven culture Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: Up to 1 Year Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 75% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. We are actively recruiting a Senior Business Development and Product Manager for Optics Products within our Engineered Optics group. This position reports directly to the head of Marketing/Product/Business Engineered Optics is a rapidly growing business within Applied Materials. We are harnessing the power of Applied Material’s world-leading material science and nano-fabrication capabilities to enable the next generation of AR displays. The purpose of the Business Development and Product Manager role is to develop deep customer engagements for our optical products that result in profitable, long-term commercial relationships. Key Responsibilities: Develop deep long term customer relationships. Negotiate and own joint development agreements and programs. Scope and coordinate customer project plans and Statements of Work, in tight collaboration with engineering Manage priorities within owned customer projects Team with Engineering, Technical Project Management, Product Marketing, Manufacturing, and Order Management Ensure customer satisfaction and execution to your commitments Transition Joint Development programs into long term profitable product lines. Negotiate supply deals. Make economic models and define pricing. Own the financials of your accounts. Shape customer and internal roadmaps. Identify and nurture new business opportunities Technical sales, field marketing and customer advocacy Onboard new customers to the system, execute quotes, and invoices Key skills and experience: Bachelor’s or Masters degree, ideally in a technical discipline. MBA a plus 10+ years work experience Excellent communication skills, including active listening and questioning to really understand what customers need, and their alternatives Fluent English language and experience communicating with people from different countries on the phone and in-person Ideally candidates from the optics, consumer device, augmented reality industries, but not essential Business savvy – understands business basics Customer empathy Excellent presentation skills Experience influencing action without owning resources Experience in managing customer projects together with the engineering team Experience managing and leading multiple projects Experience negotiating contracts and agreements Has experience with product development of physical products Has experienced new product introduction Experience in product marketing, product management a plus Startup experience a plus #LI CTO Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Key Responsibilities Actively maintains the Quality Systems Management/ ISO 9000 database and provide support for the BU users. Chairs Quality audit team meetings, plans audit schedule, reviews audit results and provides support to the team. Conducts internal audits and provide support for external audits. Ensures compliance with established internal control procedures by examining records, reports, operating practices, and documentation. Communicates audit findings by preparing audit reports; discussing findings with auditees to gain consensus. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending periodic training Develops, applies, revises, maintains and/ or tests quality/ reliability standards to ensure alignment with customer expectations. Develops containment plans for defective parts and helps drive systemic corrective actions to prevent reoccurrence through collaborations with cross-functional teams. Utilizes SAP, our Enterprise Wide Application, to facilitate the flow of defective material in MRB (Material Review Board), from its arrival to its disposition. Engages with Manufacturing to continue to improve processes to ensure Quality standards understood and met on order to exceed Customer expectations. Works closely with Manufacturing and Engineering teams to ensure products me our strict quality standards. . May be accountable for projects/ programs as wells as developing methods and parameters, project methodology and/ or project proposals. Applied Materials is shaping future tech trends by turning breakthrough ideas into reality. Our expertise in materials engineering is the foundation that computers, mobile devices and flat panel displays — products touched daily by billions of people all over the world — are built on. Join us and become a part of the next wave of engineering that makes possible AI/ML, big data, autonomous vehicles, AR/VR, IoT and more. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. In the Office of the CTO, we are focused on bringing Applied Materials innovations to new and adjacent markets. Our Engineered Optics team is creating new super thin (sub micron) optical surfaces based on nanometer-sized structures on transparent substrates (known as “metasurface based optics” or “flat optics”), which manipulate light in the deep sub wavelength domain and enable previously impossible capabilities. These components will be the most fundamental change in optics in hundreds of years and could be deployed in AR/VR devices, cameras, projectors, sensors, and a host of yet to be imagined opportunities — there is endless potential. Our dedicated and talented team is working to perfect this new technology. If you’re an entrepreneurial-oriented, enthusiastic engineer who is willing to learn and challenge yourself in creating cutting-edge technology to revolutionize the field of optics — we want you to be a part of our team. We are actively recruiting a Product Quality & Reliability Engineer within our Office of the CTO. Key Responsibilities Manages QMS and ensures compliance to requirements through internal audits, external certification ISO standards and sourcing audits via Applied's SSQA process Develop, applies, revises, and maintains quality standards for processing materials into partially finished or finished products. Designs and implements methods and procedures for testing and inspecting the quality level of products and equipment. Identify systemic issues and drive continuous improvement across the assigned business unit. Identify systemic issues and drive continuous improvement across the assigned business unit. Success in this role will be measured against business unit customer satisfaction indices and customer quality indices. Analyzes internal/external failures, suggest corrective and preventive action to respond to customer complaints. Advises design engineering on selection, application and test of electronic components and systems. Recommends design or test methods and statistical process control procedures for achieving required levels of product reliability. Perform FMECA, document CRAMS and work with supplier and engineer to enable crams test plan. Also perform PQP at supplier. Reliability modeling and ERAMS Help resolve the internal quality issues to prevent shipments of non-conforming parts and components Plan, devise and implement product life test regime prior to release, and analyze reliability & quality data for presentation to management and other relevant groups; Makes recommendations for changes in the selection and application of components and systems. May propose changes in design or formulation to improve system and/or process reliability. Develops and implements division's Quality Assurance program and policies. Act as a team leader in an effort to analyze processes, products and components to identify continuous improvements that drive product quality and increase customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities Applies extensive technical expertise in one or more safety engineering disciplines. Help to develop new standards, policies and procedures, including situations involving new substances for which no previous analysis work has been completed. Evaluates the introduction of new technologies and its potential interaction with other systems. Stay abreast of most recent research and industry trends in the field. Serves as a representative on EH&S and Product Safety industry and association boards. Develop and/or implements programs to minimize risk to employees, customer and the environment. Responsible for Product Safety programs. Serves in a consultative capacity with other internal organizations. Is the subject matter expert for Product Safety related to the hardware we develop. Leads EH&S Policy and Program development for the Company in EH&S disciplines. Has deep understanding of global operations and requirements to effectively develop and implement EH&S programs and policies. Responsible for programmatic roll-out of the policies and programs to functional owners and implementation plans. Serves as a representative on industry and association boards. Frequent interaction with senior managers and executives. Manages complex and/or large scale projects to completion by leading groups through technical expertise. Serves as the subject matter expert for both the EH&S organization and other internal organizations in providing support in EH&S issues and concerns. Has subject matter expertise in Product Safety. Acts as an industry expert representing AMAT by providing inputs to company standards or proposed industry standards in various industry forums. May interface between the company and governmental agencies Uses subject matter expertise to establish compliance evaluation methods for products, programs, and facilities to meet company and governmental requirements. Supports internal customers and external customers on complex code compliance issues, legal issues, and corporate responsibility issues. Participates in compliance evaluation of products, programs, and facilities per company and governmental requirements. Participates in the evaluation and analysis of concept and feasibility studies. Performs product/system safety analysis on components, subsystems, and systems. Prepares periodic and special reports in connection with engineering studies and projects and from liaison with other companies and outside organizations. Investigates accidents and specifies corrective action programs. May work with customer on complex code compliance issues Manage 3rd party Product Safety tool assessments and drive corrective actions within the various internal organizations. May develop and implement Product Safety training programs for operations and exposures. Evaluates and specifies work methods, design requirements, procedures and policies. Gathers EHS information and evaluates results. Administers EH&S safety training programs. May investigate accidents or incidents and analyze pertinent data and specifies corrective action. Subject matter expert in compliance evaluation of products, programs, and facilities per company and governmental requirements. May Lead investigation into incidents, product safety events, accidents and issues and analyze pertinent data for issues that may have global impact or require the subject matter expert for the organization to lead this effort. Subject matter expert in the use of 8D, FMEA, PHA and other investigation and assessment methods. Program Manager, Global Trade Job Description This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced program management professional to join a growing Legal and Compliance team and help lead and manage global trade-related strategic programs and key initiatives. In this role, you will work closely with internal Trade/Legal teams and also cross-functionally with various Applied Business Units to manage trade-focused projects including business process mapping, technology enhancements, and strategic initiatives aimed at improving operational excellence and mitigating related areas of compliance risk. Key Responsibilities Define scope, document requirements and develop detailed project plans to lead/support key business & trade-focused initiatives. Clearly identify critical milestones, map timelines, spot risks, negotiate resources and assign ownership to drive timely progress of key programs. Keep documentation organized and maintain systematized repositories to help improve visibility, increase accountability, and enable enhanced decision-making & governance. Study and use data to identify process gaps and recommend improvements that will increase efficiency and reduce compliance risk. Provide oversight, coordinate across stakeholders, communicate progress and manage escalations on projects. Prepare and present program updates, key results, and program ROIs to stakeholders and management. Manage agenda and presentation development for project-related team meetings, executive updates, and external meetings. Manage various processes and workflows, applications and tools, and improve the Trade function’s operational efficiency. Help build and maintain playbooks, procedures, program websites, online tools, and mobile apps. Help to develop KRIs and KPIs to measure program success and create and maintain data-driven dashboards that demonstrate key results. Develop and maintain a strong knowledge of the products, services, and operations of the company. Qualifications MBA, Master’s Degree in Trade Management, or similar advanced degree from a recognized university. Minimum 6 – 8 years’ relevant program management experience, preferably in the technology sector. Strong quantitative and qualitative analysis, and excellent project management skills. Experience in leading multi-disciplinary project teams or global initiatives including collaborating with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, detail-oriented, flexible, impeccable integrity, and good judgment. Collaborative by nature and able to build strong partnerships. Comfortable in a fast-paced, global environment and ability to manage and prioritize a diverse and complex workload. Self-motivated, driven, and ability to work independently and in teams. Strong presentation, Power Point and data visualization skills to communicate with stakeholders and influence decisions. Preferred Qualifications Technology background preferred. Additional language skills a plus. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. In Applied Global Services (AGS), we collaborate with customers to predict and solve manufacturing challenges, making their equipment and factories more productive through innovative technology-enabled consulting, spare parts, services, automation software and upgrades. The ICAPS/EPI/FEP Service Business Unit (SBU) group is seeking an ambitious candidate who possess a strong technical knowledge (preferably semiconductor equipment in the areas of hardware, process engineering or customer fab operations) as well as solid business acumen. The candidate will work closely with a broad matrix team to understand both internal and external customer's need and help develop business strategy to meet them. This position requires specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise. Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. Candidate will be required to help solve complex problems and take a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions. You should be able to work independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations as well as the communication skills required to develop a great partnership with cross functional team. jobTitle: R2216556 Technical Project Manager – for Epi New Product Transitions and Refurbished Systems
jobDescription: Technical Project Manager – for Epi New Product Transitions and Refurbished Systems Come join the FEP, ALD, and Epi Engineering team! We have a Technical Project Management position that encompasses two roles. The primary role is supporting Epi New Product Transition (NPT). Working as a Technical Project Manager within FEP, ALD, and Epi requires working in a team environment where the team members support each other. We also value the ability to back up other team members. Be ready and willing to work with and help other Manufacturing Engineers, Test Techs, Quality Engineers, System Project Managers, Suppliers, Business Management, Operations Management, and Finance. 300mm Epi New Products: Applied Materials is the leader in Epi. The Epi Business Unit are continuing to develop the next generation of Epi products. Our pilot manufacturing line is in Austin. We have several important programs coming up this year and next year. We need to be ready build these new products in Austin before transitioning the Epi product to our volume manufacturing line in Singapore. Our Epi strategic projects include new chamber design, new mainframe platforms, new preclean chamber designs. 300mm Refurb Systems: Most common refurbs are 300mm Epi. Second most common product is the Vantage platform. FEP, ALD, and Epi began refurbishing 300mm systems in 2013. Our refurbished systems compete head to head with the performance and quality of new systems. The Refurb PM work requires a Project Manager that is motivated and creative. Since 2013, our refurb program has meant working with upstream suppliers to prepare the system cores for build and test within our own Operations team. As the Technical Project Manager supporting the refurb program, you will be responsible for continuing the legacy of creative solutions by partnering with our suppliers and the FEP, ALD, and Epi Operations team. We focus on results and continuous improvement. Our team is consistently improving the quality of our product and we leverage innovation to improve the productivity of our workcenter. This is your chance to define and execute the best refurb strategy going forward. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates conceptual and practical expertise in Project Management and basic knowledge of Capital Equipment for Semiconductor Industry. Deeper knowledge of FEP, ALD, and Epi tools is a plus Business Expertise Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others Leadership No direct supervisory responsibilities but provides guidance to the team Able to keep team focused on program goals and system delivery on time and with high quality standards Problem Solving Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Engineering Skill Requirements Requires knowledge and experience in own discipline; still acquiring higher-level knowledge and skills. Builds knowledge of the company, processes and customers. Solves a range of straightforward problems. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction. Requires ability to learn new skills and transpose them to solving manufacturing problems. Key Responsibilities Interfaces with other engineering functions to coordinate the release of product improvements and/or new products. Launches, releases, approves and implements or issues engineering change requests as required to support design engineering and Operations with new and existing products. Estimates manufacturing costs, determines time standards and makes recommendations for tooling and process requirements. Uses DFx principles to reduce manufacturing and/or product costs, and improve delivered product quality. Test Procedures, Test Fixtures, and Syscons Develops test procedures, including assisting with the definition of test specifications with design / software engineering. Develops and refines Mayan scripts for chamber testing. Works with Central Test Engineering, Test Techs, and other Test Engineers on the design and development of test fixtures. May assist in the coordination of test fixture sourcing activities. Works with Total Product Support, Test Techs, Contract Manufacturers, and other workcenters in order to develop and maintain the merged syscons for systems. Statistical Process Control Gathers operational and test data and evaluates results; may takes corrective/continuous improvement actions. Continuous Improvement Evaluates work methods, test procedures, and workcenter policies. Participates in the development and maintenance of new and existing business processes and test strategies in order to continuously improve performance and reduce manufacturing cycle time. Failure Analysis and Non-Conformance Corrective Action Works with Customer Experience team to determine root cause of internal and external non-conformances. Drives corrective action back into test strategy based on corrective actions. Works with Customer Experience, and Design Engineers of failure analysis and drive corrective actions into test process. New Product Transitions Supports new product transitions as key manufacturing engineering team member. Works with Design Engineers to convert their test specifications into tests. Develops test strategies to efficiently test chambers to required quality and cycle time goals. Determines tooling and test fixtures required for testing new chambers as they transition into volume manufacturing environment. Business Expertise Understands key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work Leadership No direct supervisory responsibilities but provides guidance to the team Able to keep team focused on program goals and system delivery on time and with high quality standards Problem Solving Solves problems in straightforward situations; analyzes possible solutions using technical experience and judgment and precedents Impact Impacts quality of own work and the work of others on the team; works within guidelines and policies Interpersonal Skills Explains complex information to others in straightforward situations #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Key Responsibilities Management/Planning: Plan and manage the outsource labor component of the Regional installation workforce through collaboration with iTeam Regional Management and Regional Procurement. Serve as a cross-functional link with the Region; maintain open communication among matrixed stakeholders including iTeam, FSO, Sales, BUs, Procurement, VMO, Legal, and Finance. Influence others across a matrix of functions throughout the program/project. Analyze projected Region/BU cost savings for accuracy and align on commits. Drive pipeline projects for current and next fiscal year. SOW Management: Ensure accurate Statements of Work (SOWs) for Standard Tier0 are developed and maintained by iTeam Regional Managers (iRMs) for relevant products and Customers in a centralized (master) source location for the Region. Timely submit SOWs to Regional Purchasing within required lead times. Review and approve/reject SOWs in FieldGlass. Partner with iRMs to optimize SOW task content by Outsource Service Engineers (OSEs) and minimize tasks by Applied Regular Full Time (RFT). Partner with team members to analyze labor cost and identify cost reduction opportunities through install content reduction, install content re-allocation from RFT to OSE, should cost, and commercial means; track and ensure timely implementation of such opportunities. Outsource Invoicing and Purchases Requisitions (PRs): Review and approve/reject PRs from Regional Procurement and SOW invoices in FieldGlass. Drive appropriate actions with Procurement and respective Outsource Service Provider (OSP) company as needed. Monitor pricing to ensure competition between OSPs and balance with prevailing local market. Through guidance from Global Outsource Labor Manager, maintain and manage centralized pricing tables by OSP and Product (if relevant) in conjunction with Regional Procurement and alignment from iTeam iPMs/iRMs. Coordination/Planning: Engage cross-functionally with Regional Procurement, iTeam, FSO, and OSP companies on workforce planning (long term), assignment/coordination (short term), technical performance requirements/compliance, and advise in commercial terms/pricing as needed. Coordinate with OSPs, iRMs, and Planners on OSE resource assignment scheduling. Regional OSP Support, Capability Tracking, & Profile: Manage and track Regional OSP support and product capabilities. Identify future business needs or risks to address or invest in (i.e. OSP workforce expansion or new product qualification, additional/new OSP, etc). In conjunction with Procurement, review, verify and maintain Regional OSP profile matrix. KPI Performance: Manage regional outsource labor cost, hours, cycle time, quality, and coverage metrics and reporting for Region by BU. Present progress and results to key stakeholders, management and internal customers. OSE Qualification: Identify needs for OSE qualification on new or additional products and coordinate with iRMs and Regional Procurement to plan/implement near term OJT. Facilitate sharing of required Tier0 installation procedures/documentation with OSPs via Supplier Collaboration Vault (SCV) and Regional Procurement. Maintain a central location for tracking OSP qualification (including qualification records) for the Region by OSP and Product. Outsource Labor Forecasting/Planning: Provide long term installation forecast projections (by Product and Customer Fab) and engage with Procurement to align OSP capacity supply (by Product and Customer). Achieve alternate supplier/solution qualification to optimize cost and ensure supply continuity. Drive outsource labor capacity and assignment alignment with supporting organizations and provide project management oversight with guidance from Global Outsource Labor Manager. Accounting/Finance: Train team members on all aspects of Tier0 outsource accounting and drive accurate cost settlement. Engage with iRMs and BU I&W Managers to ensure accurate outsource costs are used in Tier0 Outsource Plans. Outsource Management KPIs, QBRs, and Quality: Ensure execution of and participation in quarterly operational business reviews, in conjunction with Regional Procurement, for each active OSP in the region. Recommend enhancements to the OSP scorecard evaluations. Engage with iRMs to ensure OSE workmanship events are fully documented and communicated to Regional Procurement for appropriate resolution action. Project/Program Management: Prepare project plans and drive the project from conception and planning to implementation. Participate in the development of strategies, processes and resources. Manage project schedule and task details by utilizing project management tools such as reports, tracking charts, checklist and project scheduling software. Participate on multifunctional design teams comprised of internal, external and/or matrixed headcount to complete projects. Provide technical input to team members to achieve project goals. Interface and coordinate within organizations to define project objectives, provide status updates and prepare for release and deployment. Identify and resolve potential complications within the project and develop solutions for resolution. Research causes to project obstacles/barriers and assists in implementing solutions for resolution. With limited / no supervision, use standard tools, dashboards and BKMs to analyze and manage outsourced labor KPIs. Develop superior knowledge of AMAT sourcing, materials and purchasing business processes to ensure best possible results. At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible the technology shaping the future. We are actively recruiting for a Revenue Analyst! This position reports directly to the Business Unit CFO of EPI. Functional Knowledge Hands-on expertise in RF systems, including high power RF generator, impedance matching network, transmission line, and RF filter. jobTitle: Semiconductor Operations Technical Project Manager IV - (E4)
jobDescription: Key Responsibilities Prepares project plans and drives the project from conception and planning to implementation. Will participate in the development of strategies, processes and resources. Manages project schedule and task details by utilizing project management tools such as reports, tracking charts, checklist and project scheduling software. Coordinates allocated resources from within the Division to achieve on-time and within budget performance objectives for the project. Initiates and manages purchase requisitions, and purchase orders. Drives cost schedule performance of equipment for internal and external customers and vendors worldwide. Participates on multifunctional design teams comprised of internal, external and/or matrixed headcount to complete projects. Provides technical input to team members to achieve project goals. Interfaces and coordinates within the division to define project objectives, provide status updates and prepare for release and deployment. Provides engineering and business process expertise to team and other members on various standard programs / issues. Identifies and resolves potential complications within the project and develops solutions for resolution. Job Description This role will be working primarily in the OEM power distribution commodities, but will time to time manage other Semiconductor Projects. The right candidate will have the opportunity to work with most of the business units of Applied Materials, and manage highly visible projects. The projects will include: Design Phase NPI and Production sourcing agreements Initial Builds Design updates Production Release Ensuring robust supply chain which apply lessons learned from previous projects This role will ensure commonality of developed BKMs are applied to all steps of the project, which will span areas from communication methodologies, supply chain strategies, component selections for design, and BU cut in plans. Weekly reports and status updates on major projects will be expected and will be used to accumulate monthly and quarterly report outs to executive management. At times this candidate may be assigned to fill in roles for Materials Program Management or Supply Chain Management roles depending on the available resources for the project in question. Key Responsibilities Ensures that specific project and program objectives are defined for areas of responsibility, and that necessary preliminary activities (e.g., determination of outcomes, milestones, viability studies, and resource planning, among others) are completed to allow for effectiveness and focus during later stages of completion. Ensures that all projects and programs assigned are completed in accordance with predetermined requirements, with specific attention to product/process specifications, project/program costs, resource utilization, and timeliness for completion. Ensures that all phases of project, program and/or process development are documented and that information required in other functional areas is reported, disseminated, or transferred, as appropriate. Ensures compliance with Company policies regarding Engineering/Lab notebooks, patents, confidentiality and safety. Ensures that the utilization of all material and financial resources is carried out in an effective manner. Effectively work with other staff to maximize productivity for the project / program.
