jobTitle: Senior Analog Mixed Signal Integrated Circuit Design Engineer - (E5)
jobDescription: In this role, you will be enabling the team to develop new and novel technologies for In-memory computing targeted towards AI applications. You will be part of a team working on emerging memory technologies and will have the opportunity to develop novel analog/mixed signal circuits to enable functionality. The ideal candidate will have desire to learn, rethink the current norms and a desire to push the technology envelope forward. Key Responsibilities Develop novel IC solutions for low-power, low-cost analog and mixed-signal computing including analog and digital signal processing concepts Design of analog and mixed-signal building blocks including silicon validation and supervision of layout activities. Effective technical verbal/written communication representing the org with limited supervision. Ability to collaborate with internal stakeholders, customers and vendors Collaborates/participate in discussions to solve interdisciplinary technical issues in a cross-functional team environment. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates depth and/or breadth of expertise in own specialized discipline or field Problem Solving Leads others to solve complex problems; uses sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions Required Qualifications: MSEE with 10+ years of experience or Ph.D 5+ years IC design Experience in at least one preferably multiple area of CMOS circuit: ADC, DAC, low power high performance amplifiers, LDO regulator and high stability references. Strong device physics and layout knowledge (FinFET is plus) Preferred Qualifications: MATLAB, Verilog-A modeling PCB design experience Knowledge of lab equipment including digital oscilloscopes, signal generators and network analyzer testers Good written and oral communication skills Self-motivated and problem solver Curiosity to learn and share the knowledge #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Position Description Applied Materials, Inc. is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible the technology shaping the future. The Legal & Compliance Organization has an exciting position for a Senior Data Scientist to join a multi-disciplinary group that works collaboratively within Legal and jointly with the Information Security, Business Unit, and Corporate Services teams to conduct a wide range of business intelligence and investigation support functions. This role will be located in either Santa Clara, CA or Austin, TX. Part-time remote work is possible for the ideal candidate. This critical role works closely with each pillar within the Legal Department to create metrics, visualize critical trends, and identify high risk areas. This is the opportunity to work with a newly formed team that is responsible for designing, creating, and maintaining regular, ad-hoc and automated reports and dashboards to support strategic initiatives, policy development, monitoring & enforcement and investigations. This position requires strong analytic capabilities, technical prowess, communication skills, creativity, and leadership. Major Areas of Responsibility Responsibilities for this position include data retrieval, formatting, analysis, summarization, and visualization. This position will also be responsible for developing and maintaining department SharePoint sites and dashboards supporting the different teams and strategic initiatives. IT experience will be required to access and support disparate IT systems and assist legal personnel on a variety of technical issues. This role requires the ability to design & develop programs, methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze diverse data sources. Processes and programs will be used to cleanse, integrate, and evaluate datasets from multiple disparate sources. The resulting analytics and visualizations will be used by executive-level decision makers to gain actionable insights. Specific Responsibilities Data wrangling, including data discovery, data mining, data structuring, cleaning, enriching, and validating Design, develop, and maintain metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards that will be used to drive key business decisions, strategy, policy, and investigations Data exploration to identify statistical relationships, trends, patterns, and anomalies Organize and transform data into comprehensible, usable, and actionable information Elicit reporting and analysis requirements from the legal team and deliver solutions Ensure the accuracy, timeliness and confidentiality of data sources and derived information Educate & train the users on the supported sites, dashboards, and reports Utilize Tableau to create topical dashboards for high-level decision makers Build solutions by partnering with key stakeholders, including the IT, Information Security, Big Data and Enterprise Process Solutions teams Qualifications Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technology-related field from an accredited university Experience with Tableau and Tableau Prep SharePoint or Web development experience Project management experience Professional use of SQL, Hadoop, Hue, Hive, Impala and SAP ERP Experience with Splunk, Exabeam, OneTrust, or SailPoint IQ Basic programming skills in one of the following: Python, PowerShell, Visual Basic Strong attention to detail, passion for data accuracy, and high personal integrity Ability to perform statistical analysis of data Working knowledge of web development tools – e.g., XML, HTTP, Java, JavaScript, and HTML Excellent communication skills. Ability to clearly articulate and visually present complex information and analysis results. Capable of writing concise reports targeted for the audience in terms that they will understand using a variety of graphical, easy-to-understand representations Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 10 - 15 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

At Applied Materials, our vision is to Make Possible® a Better Future. As the world’s #1 semiconductor and display equipment company, our innovations enable the technology breakthroughs that enrich peoples’ lives. We are looking for an energetic leader with a passion for technology and storytelling to lead our Media Relations function. The media relations leader will be a key member of the Investor Relations and Marketing Communications team which orchestrates Applied’s external communications globally, working with all of our corporate executives, business leaders, communications functions, agencies and global teams. The leader is responsible for creating and implementing our media relations strategy and programs to increase Applied’s visibility and influence the perception of the company with media and other key external stakeholders. Works closely with internal executives and technology leaders to create unique and compelling narratives that align to strategic themes. Develops messaging and content that can be understood and appreciated by a broad audience. Partners with our global teams to regionalize news and stories for our sites across Europe and Asia. Key responsibilities include: Working with internal experts to define, plan and execute Applied’s media relations strategy. Driving media relations plans, budgets, initiatives and programs. Leading outreach to key technology and business press, and industry analysts to increase frequency of coverage of Applied in the media. Expanding Applied’s reach by fostering relationships with new reporters and influencers. Launching Applied’s new technologies and products through various communications channels, including press releases, blogs and social media. Generating stories and writing content for the Applied Blog Partnering with colleagues in the company’s global business units, investor relations team, employee communications group and government affairs team. Guiding regional communications teams on external messaging and media programs. Giving direction to PR agency resources. Skills and experience required: At least 15 years prior corporate PR/communications, PR agency and/or journalism experience Recent/relevant experience in the technology industry is a must. Semiconductor industry knowledge is strongly preferred. Strong writing skills. Ability to translate complex technologies into compelling stories for a variety of external audiences. Demonstrated track record of successful media campaigns/PR programs. Driven leader with the ability to work with and influence all levels of management and personnel. Team player. Demonstrated ability to take direct responsibility for program execution and delivery including hands-on involvement in deliverables. Strong decision making skills; ability to come up with creative solutions to challenges as they arise. Creative thinker; takes a new perspective on existing solutions and processes. Values people and develops the team. Energetic, motivated and passionate. Good sense of humor is a plus. Position requires understanding of Applied Materials global Standards of Business Conduct and compliance with these standards at all times. This includes demonstrating the highest level of ethical conduct reflecting Applied Materials' core values. Qualifications Education: Bachelor’s Degree required, MBA or other advanced communications or technical degree valued Years of Experience: 15+ Years Additional Information Travel: Potentially yes, 20% of time Relocation Eligible: Yes Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 15+ Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Sr. Field Service Engineer If you like to troubleshoot hardware, solve complex problems and make equipment work better, this is the role for you. As a Field Service Engineer, you’ll work in our state-of-the-art facility and at customer sites around the globe, where you are the face of Applied Materials and an integral part of a vibrant and diverse team. Our senior-level Field Service Engineers work independently, and help train junior colleagues, to create and support the technology that the world relies on to manufacture semiconductor chips and related materials. You’ll work beside global customers to install, maintain and upgrade their Applied Materials equipment, delivering world-class support for multimillion-dollar production systems. You will: Install leading-edge customer equipment, perform scheduled preventative maintenance and corrective maintenance, and upgrade equipment Use your troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, as well as company diagnostic tools and documentation, to solve complex equipment issues Generate, follow and possibly approve documented procedures and published task plans Lead projects (when needed), document progress, and communicate with customer and internal business units on progress Complete required job documentation, safety training and procedures for processing parts Professionally represent Applied Materials to the customer, using your “customer first” mindset Satisfy the company’s and customer’s on-site requirements, including safety, environmental and COVID-19 guidelines Train junior engineers on site-related safety, troubleshooting procedures, and developing a customer-first mindset You’ll need: An associate degree in electronics or engineering technologies, or equivalent work experience, or completion of military technical training and field experience Ability to read electrical and mechanical schematics, and an advanced knowledge of pneumatics, hydraulics, electronics, vacuum and/or thermodynamics Clear and effective written/verbal communications skills, with an emphasis on documenting details, and proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) Strong knowledge of hand tools and proper usage, including a digital multimeter Advanced knowledge of wafer processing parameters Extensive knowledge of Applied Materials systems and company processes Project management skills, and an ability to lead key customer and internal product meetings Nice to have: 7–10 years of work experience in semiconductor industry or another equipment support industry What to expect: You’ll work on rotation and in shifts so that customers have ongoing support Your job requires the ability to: lift at least 35 lbs. work in a clean room environment wearing coveralls, hood, booties, safety glasses, and gloves sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach and stretch to reach equipment when needed, and stand for extended periods of time determine differences in colors You’ll need a valid driver’s license and passport Your benefits: At Applied Materials, we care about the wellbeing of our people, and we strive to support you in ways that extend beyond your work environment. As an employee, you’ll qualify for a competitive and comprehensive total rewards and benefits package, from day one. Your benefits package will be customized for your country of residence and may include: top-tier medical, dental and vision plans; disability insurance; life insurance; retirement; paid time off; health and wellness programs; career development and mentoring; sustainability and social responsibility programs; and much more. Additionally, all employees can take advantage of our company-sponsored global programs, including our Employee Assistance Program, Travel Accident/Medical Benefits Abroad, the company’s employee stock purchase program and a subscription to wellbeing tools. We value social responsibility, too: Our worldwide “Giving” program encourages employee giving and volunteering globally, while The Applied Materials Foundation provides an employee match of up to US$3,000 per employee per year. Who we are: Applied Materials is the global leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. We’re the brain (and the brawn) behind every new technology development—whether it’s building semiconductor chips for smartphones and computers, or the underpinnings for robotics, AI and even smart TV display screens. With 27,000 employees in 19 countries, we offer an exciting place to grow and learn alongside some of the best people you’ll ever meet. We take deep pride in our Culture of Inclusion, and we celebrate the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experiences that help us build stronger, more resilient teams. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we actively recruit diverse talent. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status or any other basis prohibited by law. Join us as we innovate to Make Possible a Better Future! #LI Qualifications Education: Associate's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. Summary The Etch Semiconductor business unit is a leading part of the current and ongoing growth of Applied Materials and is a key element of its strategic position in the semiconductor equipment market. This is a Senior Financial Analyst role focused on Revenue and Gross Margin analysis, reporting to the Etch Assistant Controller. This role is critical to for driving growth and profitability for the Etch BU, delivering predictable revenue & gross margin results for the corporation, and contributing to the long-term success of Applied Materials. Key Responsibilities Participate in and owns portions of the preparation of the annual operating plan, long-term strategic plan, quarterly forecasts and quarter-end financial reporting for revenue, gross margin, and the balance sheet Develop complex modeling in support of strategic plans, business sizing and performance management Collaborate with Business Management on customer deals, including profitability analysis Partner with Business Management to drive accurate forecasting and reporting as relates to customer evaluations of new products Coordinate with corporate accounting to ensure accurate forecast of revenue impacted by multi-element arrangement requirements Partner with world-wide operations to manage build plan, inventory, and drive high accuracy of cost forecasts Develop complex modeling in support of strategic plans, business sizing and performance management Collaborate with BU finance teams on process improvements and support key corporate initiatives Supports Etch Assistant Controller and business unit CFO with ad hoc data analysis requests or projects (incl. Product / Program valuations, detailed spending analysis, inventory analysis) Proficient at extracting and manipulating datasets from relational databases Experience extracting insights from data and presenting them to an audience Qualifications & Preferences Proven competencies in financial analysis, communication and working cross-functionally with different levels of management to drive results. Self-starter: able to maintain financial cycle deliverables identify change and drive items to closure with minimal management oversight. Experience with financial modeling, with proficiency in using Excel or other related tools Experience with Semiconductor Equipment or Components Manufacturing is desired but not required Foster a positive team environment, support team members and actively share ideas to help the team and business meet its objectives Experience in extracting and manipulating data sets using SQL or another programming / scripting language (e.g. Python, R) - Is a Plus Experience with data visualization/analytics tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) Experience extracting insights from data and presenting them to an audience Education & Experience Master's degree preferred 7+ years of experience, semiconductor equipment or components manufacturing preferred Company Facts: Ticker: Nasdaq: AMAT Market Cap: $134.5 billion Fiscal 2020 Revenue: $17.2 billion Fiscal 2020 R&D: $2.2 billion Founded: November 10, 1967 Headquarters: Santa Clara, California Global Presence: 110 locations in 19 countries Manufacturing: China, Germany, Israel, Italy, Singapore, Switzerland, Taiwan, United States Employees: ~24,000 worldwide Patents: ~14,300 issued Fortune World’s most admired companies 2021, Top 100 Barron’s most sustainable companies 2021 #LI Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Applied Materials, Inc. is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible the technology shaping the future. We are actively recruiting for an experienced Financial Analyst to join our world-class finance team. This role under World-Wide Operations Costing/Gross Margin will support financial and planning activities, including actual reporting, forecasting, and business analysis activities for a Semiconductor Business Group. The person coming into this role will partner with the business segments to enable actionable analytics and reporting. The ideal candidate needs to be comfortable with working on End of Quarter Close requirements, enhancing financial reporting capabilities, and forecast deliverables related to regular business cycles. Major Responsibilities Performs analysis on built material costs to ensure correct tool valuation compared to Bill of Materials & reconciles weekly Analyzes Production Order Material Variances & communicates with Operations to resolve issues identified during variance analysis Provides support to World-Wide Operations teams to resolve systemic issues related to Finance attributes which prevent transactions from processing Completes detailed requirements for monthly / quarterly close processes including Work In Progress, Finished Goods, Deferred and Eval Inventory Performs Financial Modeling and Analysis to support Gross Margin reporting for finance executives Leads Aged WIP Inventory Reviews & Provides reserve analysis Leads Balance Sheet Review Meetings with Finance Controllers Interacts as a direct business partner with business unit executives, delivering analysis and recommendations to guide operational and financial decisions Participates in team discussions for system integration and process improvement initiatives and execution of those projects (UAT Testing) Partner with GIS and with other business areas to enable implementation of new reporting systems and processes Works closely with internal auditors to address SOX requirements Qualifications & Preferences Bachelor’s Degree (Finance, Accounting, or Business-related degree preferred) 4-7 years of experience in Finance/Accounting for a reputable firm Strong analytical & financial modeling skills Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Attention to detail. Ability to think clearly and work effectively with cross-functional teams Curiosity to learn the business & improve upon existing processes Experience in new business intelligence technologies, tools & concepts such as Python, Hadoop, Tableau, Machine Learning a strong plus Must be proactive, possess solid financial analytic skills, communication skills, and be self-directed Must work effectively with all levels of management and with various functions (finance, operations, manufacturing) in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with multiple and often changing priorities. Company Facts: Ticker: Nasdaq: AMAT Market Cap: $123.39 billion Fiscal 2021 Revenue: $23.06 billion Founded: November 10, 1967 Headquarters: Santa Clara, California Global Presence: 93 locations in 17 countries Manufacturing: China, Germany, Israel, Italy, Singapore, Switzerland, Taiwan, United States Employees: ~24,000 worldwide Patents: >14.300 issued Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobTitle: Senior FP&A Analyst - Display & Flexible Technologies (B4)
jobDescription: FP&A Analyst (B4) – (Internal/External) The Display and Flexible Technologies group within Applied Materials is the leader in providing leading edge technology to the makers of the most advanced displays in the world. As a standalone product segment in Applied the DFT team operates primarily in five different countries – US, Taiwan, China, Germany and Korea – and has the atmosphere of working in a small company within the larger Applied portfolio. This role under the DFT Financial Planning & Analysis controller will support driving the financial and planning activities, including budgeting, forecasting, and business analysis activities for the Display Segment. The person coming into this role will partner with the business segments to enable actionable analytics and reporting. The ideal candidate needs to be comfortable with working on both strategic initiatives, such as enhancing financial reporting capabilities/systems, and with deliverables related to regular business cycles. This person will serve as the primary analyst on segment gross margin as well as helping summarize the data related to market trends and drivers, competitors, business unit financials. They will proactively work with key business partners across the company’s finance organization to understand and help further develop reports and processes that are both efficient and can scale with the company’s growth. This position will involve analyzing and developing content for Executive Management, Product groups, Investor Relations, and Corporate. The right individual will have a strong work ethic and desire to continuously learn while using their skillsets and findings to extend/enhance the financial reporting processes as well as analyses. Job Overview The FP&A Manager is responsible for providing timely and accurate analysis to assist management in its goal of making fact-based decisions. Responsibilities include partnering with Global FP&A and internal finance business partners in DFT Segment level consolidating, modeling, and analyzing financial related data to measure and report on the performance of the business. Additionally, FP&A Manager will lead financial cadence and calendar for total Segment for actuals and forecasting process, Manage Segment Opex and HQ department spending, and business partner to DFT Segment Executive Management in the financial analysis and support of various functions. FP&A Roles And Responsibilities Compile, maintain and present quarterly financial reporting packages to Segment Mgmt Lead Segment integration of new Financial FP&A Software and drive Change Management process and communications within the DFT Finance Organization Partner with Segment finance controllers for forecast and report revenue and expenses Manage total segment Opex Portfolio of Investment spending and Capital, issue targets, mitigate escalations for getting back to target achievement Drive adaption SAP tools, reports, and data repositories into DFT finance cadence and business process requirements Maintain the Segment’s financial models (P&L, B/S, and CF) as well as other operational models and reports Identify and develop the business requirements that will be translated into key performance indicators / objectives Identify and improve operational inefficiencies within current processes to enhance overall group effectiveness Actively seek new tools and ideas to help management better understand and plan our business TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities) Highly Proficient in Microsoft Excel including Power Query with the ability to build / develop complex models Strong analytical skill and business sense Strong written and verbal communication skills, including Executive Levels Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders Ability to develop and maintain complex financial models and generate key insights Ability to make decisions independently, or escalate when applicable Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy Deadline-driven with a strong sense of urgency Education And Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or equivalent combination of education and relevant experience Minimum 5 years’ experience, with heavy emphasis in financial modeling, analysis, and reporting SAP/COPA/BW/BPC reporting package experience a plus #LI Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: No Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Job Description Role Description: We are looking for a senior full stack developer / team lead to join our team. You will be leading a team delivering line of business applications that accelerate R&D in the company. You’ll be hands on development and managing a team including developers in India. You’ll be interacting directly with business stakeholders and end users, translating their requirements into technical architecture. And for certain projects, you will not be hands on and playing a PM role interfacing with the business users directly and then working with the India team to manage the delivery. You must have strong communication and customer interaction skills and experience. You’ll be joining an entrepreneurial IT organization that has been named by Computerworld’s "100 Best Places to Work in IT" list for the last 10 years in a row. Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field or equivalent years of professional experience Excellent customer interaction & communications skills, you will be interfacing directly with business stakeholders and end users gathering requirements and feedback 10+ years of experience as Full Stack Software Engineering/ Software Development in a professional environment C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework Understanding of JavaScript frameworks like React.js/Angular/Vue SQL Server query design Experience designing, building, and operating enterprise grade cloud scale websites Experience working with leadership and key stakeholders throughout the business Familiarity with cloud technologies Experience collaborating in an Agile environment Experience in web framework Demonstrated ability to learn and master complex technology Experience collaborating and coordinating with remote developers (mainly India) Experience with API development Understanding of JavaScript frameworks like React.js/Angular/Vue Familiarity with RESTful APIs Knowledge of modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc. Working knowledge of docker, DevOps and CI/CD Experience with microservices architecture Good experience on version management tools like git Key Qualifications: Ability to manage multiple, competing priorities in a fast-paced, constantly changing environment Ability to work with a distributed team in multiple locations around the world Ability to build good working relationships with an established team of cross-functional partners Strong communication skills and proficient in the English language Expert attention to detail and organizational skills Education BE/BTech/MCA or equivalent. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - jobTitle: Senior Manager, Supply Chain Finance and Trade Systems
jobDescription: Key responsibilities: Lead a team and serve as a focal with selected business units and GIS Operations, Engineering and Finance domains for the purpose of ERP, Business intelligence, big data and AI/ML technology strategy alignment, solution discovery, service management, project portfolio mgmt. Manage personnel serving as business unit or function sub-group integration Understand, learn, validates and ensures design integrity of business process/business application solutions to address complex cross functional needs. Manage personnel performing solution architecture, application and/or platform specification configuration for complex individual projects and/or across multiple, concurrent projects, and the development of testing and data conversion strategies. Identifies and recommend industry BKM's for integrated solution design and standards, and develop and enforce defined standards; Keeps abreast of technologies in the market and drives new technology evaluations. Manage personnel responsible for providing business application functional support services to meet customer performance, availability, service level agreements and customer satisfaction targets. Ensure systems are monitored and tuned for availability and performance, and that rigorous root cause analysis is performed and preventative/corrective actions implemented. Manages and oversees execution of application life cycle activities. Deliver and manage personnel responsible for delivery of project and support services in area of responsibility within allocated budget. Develops project budgets. Develops deep understanding cost model and cost drivers for service(s) and develops and implements service area budgets and cost optimization initiatives. Responsible for timely renewal of maintenance and subscription contracts. Monitors and ensures adherence to GIS project management, software application development, testing, service management, change management, RCA and other relevant processes, standards, governance and controls. May manage execution of sox controls and testing, and support internal and external audits. Plan and manage large scale, complex cross functional business application projects to ensure effective and efficient execution in line with guardrails of scope, timeline, budget and quality. Manages project managers. Oversees vendor delivery in an outcome-based SOW and/or time and material engagement performing services across multiple projects or service areas. Ensures contingent workforce utilization is optimized. Works with management and strategic providers to identify gaps and opportunities and to recommend improvement plans. May approve contingent worker timesheets/SOW costs. Functional Knowledge: Demonstrates comprehensive understanding of concepts and principles within own job family and knowledge of other related job families. Business Expertise: Applies in-depth understanding of how own discipline integrates within the segment/function Good understanding and practical experience working with supply chain, logistics and manufacturing systems and processes is a must Decent understanding of Operations Finance and budgeting and cost control of supply chain operations is required In-depth understanding and experience working with Trade processes and systems, such as SAP GTS, etc. Certification of Trade professional is a strong plus SAP ECC FI/CO, especially Controlling module is strongly preferred, S/4 HANA Finance experience is a plus, specifically, Inventory Management/Reporting, Material Ledger, SAP HANA, Product Costing, Profit Center Accounting Upstream working knowledge of SAP MM/IM, SD, PP is required Leadership: Manages multiple related teams, sets organizational priorities and allocates resources. Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves complex technical, operational and organizational problems. Impact: Impacts the business results of a team or area by supporting and funding of projects, products, services and/or technologies and developing policies and plans. Guided by business unit, department or sub-functional business plans. Interpersonal Skills: Influences others internally and externally, including senior management. jobTitle: Senior Program Manager, Gas Delivery Systems - (E5)
jobDescription: In this position as a Senior Program Manager, you will lead the development, qualification and manufacturing introduction of new gas delivery solutions for the semiconductor industry. Requires > 10 years of experience of design and project management experience, and a proven track record of bringing solutions from development into manufacturing. Experience developing gas delivery solutions for the semiconductor equipment industry preferred. MS in Engineering preferred. Key Responsibilities Develops project plan and oversees from conception and planning to implementation, including strategies, processes and resources. Ensures objectives are clearly defined and agreed to across the business unit. Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. We are actively recruiting for a Senior Supplier Quality Engineer to support our Implants Business Unit in Gloucester, MA! We are currently open to Newly College Graduates as well! The SE team is a supportive, cross-functional team with many different skillsets and experiences, lending itself to many learning opportunities from within the team. Additionally, Applied Materials has extensive internal and external training programs offering various certifications and development opportunities tailored specifically for the engineer’s skill sets and goals. The highly dynamic workload is project-focused, allowing the engineer to manage individual work schedules. Key Responsibilities Develops and applies quality standards in accordance with company and customer requirements. Develops and conducts related tests. Manages all issues related to supplier quality in a variety of commodity areas including Build to Print, Contract Manufacturing, Mechanical, OEM, Consumables, and Electro-mechanical assemblies. Lead supplier qualification, ISO and process audits, develops gap analysis plans, manages supplier improvement plans, and monitors ongoing progress. Drives compliance and improvements in a wide variety of supplier processes and technologies in order to achieve the company's quality requirements. Generates reports, quality data, presentations and quality plans and communicates regularly with Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, and Suppliers. Designs and implements methods and procedures for inspecting, testing, and evaluating the precision and accuracy of products and/ or production equipment. Develops methods and parameters, project methodology and/ or project proposals. Develops and uses procedures. Prepares documentation for inspection/ testing procedures. Recommends corrective action for procedural, product, or process deficiencies. Analyze operational data; Develop and implement recommendations. Participates in and may lead audits. Evaluates work methods, procedures, and policies. Tracks progress of qualification status, reviews reliability test results, determines the disposition of non-compliant products, reviews, and releases qualification packs Utilizes drawings, specifications, industry standards, and sketches, adapting inspection measuring devices and procedures when necessary. Read and interpret technical drawings and specification requirements. Reduces qualification cycle time and cost while still meeting quality performance requirements. Job Description Applied Materials, Inc. is the global leader in providing innovative equipment, services, and software to enable the manufacture of advanced semiconductor, flat panel display, and solar photovoltaic products. Our technologies help make innovations like smartphones, flat-screen TVs, and solar panels more affordable and accessible to consumers and businesses around the world. At Applied Materials, we turn today's innovations into the industries of tomorrow. We are actively recruiting for a Financial Analyst to join our Service Business Unit team within Applied Global Services. The AGS segment provides integrated solutions to optimize equipment and fab performance and productivity, including spares, services, upgrades, remanufactured earlier generation equipment and factory automation software for semiconductor, display, and other products.  Customer demand for products and services is fulfilled through a global distribution network system with 90 locations and trained service engineers, located in close proximity to customer sites in more than a dozen countries, to support over 38,000 installed Applied Semiconductor, Display, and other manufacturing systems worldwide. Key Responsibilities Support consolidation and reporting related to financial close, forecast cycles, strategic planning and ROI analysis Collaborate with cross functional teams in performing detailed analysis for finance and non-finance stakeholders Support management in completing ad hoc reports and providing data driven insights into business performance Develop financial models, run scenario analysis and provide support in analyzing margins, risks and opportunities. Lead the effort in streamlining management reporting and centralizing information and analytics Proactively identify and drive process improvement initiatives Qualifications & Preferences Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong excel modeling skills, experience with Tableau and Power BI a plus Collaborative working style, excellent communication, and presentation skills Self-starter with a positive attitude and ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment Education: Bachelor’s degree in business/accounting/finance or related field Experience: 2-4 years of finance experience Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 2 - 4 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Not Specified Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Key Responsibilities Can safely operate most of the major shop tools (CNC Router, Laser, Water Jet, Sheet Metal Brake, Teflon Press, Manual Mill, Manual Lathe, Fork Lift, and Cranes) performing basic operations in producing prototype parts, production parts, modifications and repairs to existing parts and assemblies. Supports in-house customers, such as manufacturing, engineering, business units. Portrays a customer service approach. Interfaces effectively and courteously with customers and co-workers. Utilizes Work Orders, blueprints, sketches, written and verbal instructions to determine machining process, procedures, tooling and fixtures requirements. Performs a variety of machining and/or assembly tasks utilizing standard machine shop equipment, such as surface grinders, drill presses, grinders, sanders, band saws, routers, and/or standard power tools. Plans and performs complex machine set-ups. Possesses a good working knowledge of trigonometry, which is required to accurately calculate angles used in set-ups and machining. Makes full use of machine capacity to minimize amount of machining or number of set-ups required to product parts competitively. Can nest parts to maximize material efficiency reducing waste. Plans and performs moderately complex machine set-ups. Possesses a basic knowledge of trigonometry, which is required to accurately calculate angles used in set-ups and machining. Maintains cleanliness of the work area and ensures proper handling of tools, equipment, and stock to prevent loss. Conforms to departmental safety requirements. Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions that enables the production of virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s Definition of Winning. Applied Materials’ Common Systems Software Team is looking for Software Engineers to design and implement real-time sequencing and scheduling algorithms for our semiconductor processing equipment. The sequencer is the key part of the system that is responsible for scheduling the movement and processing of wafers through different stations to deliver optimal throughput while meeting various timing constraints. You will design and code software while working alongside an experienced team of world-class professionals in a highly collaborative environment playing a key role in the development of software for Applied Materials’ equipment that will enable advances in semiconductor technology. Key features of this job are listed below. Working closely with extended engineering team to understand equipment capabilities and scheduling requirements Designing and implementing scheduling software for various semiconductor machines Enhancing existing code to deliver improvements for performance and reliability Preferred location for these positions is Santa Clara, California or Austin, Texas but any other US location is acceptable if you have the required background Qualifications: BS/MS in Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Mathematics or related fields 2-10 years of experience in large scale software development using C++ programming language Strong verbal and written communication skills Key Responsibilities Interface with internal and external customers regarding requirements Deliver new features to meet emerging requirements. Evaluate various design and algorithmic options to meet requirements. Develop scheduler software modules and libraries for use across multiple products. Develop test for various use-cases and software documentation Troubleshoot a wide range of moderate to complex software problems Technical Skills Proficiency and experience in C/C++ is required In addition, programming experience in several of the following areas are desired: C#, .NET Visual Studio Source Control Windows application development. Prior experience with soft real-time systems is a plus Prior experience/knowledge with following is a plus Job-shop scheduling algorithms and approaches Application of Machine Learning approaches (e.g., Reinforced Learning) to scheduling problems Leadership, Communication And Problem-Solving Skills Combines technical skills with effective relationship building and collaboration skills Has excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to analyze complex information and explain in a straightforward manner Evaluates possible solutions using technical experience and judgment Is result oriented and has passion to contribute ideas, influence others and to succeed Travel: Occasional, less than 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes, within US only Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobTitle: Software Engineer III - Unity Full Stack - (E3)
jobDescription: Company Introduction Applied Materials, Inc. is the global leader in materials engineering solutions for the semiconductor, flat panel display and solar photovoltaic (PV) industries. Appliedx is an innovation driven group within the company focusing on using VR, AR, MR technologies for instructional design, simulation, training and troubleshooting. A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and a quality product are essential. quality, and responsiveness of applications Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to address and mitigate these problems Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization years of experience with 3D graphics development Familiarity with current design and architectural patterns Skilled at writing clean, readable, and easily maintainable code 1+ years of experience with pipeline and asset management automation Experience implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests Proficient knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, SVN Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer science, game design and development or similar fields OR equivalent work experience Preferred Skills Experience with Hololens, Mixed Reality Headsets, Oculus, Google Cardboard and other leading AR/VR platforms Experience with application performance optimization – shader writing, editor scripting Experience with UX, UI Experience with AR and computer vision Prior experience with a At Applied Materials, our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. Job Description: This Sr Financial Analyst role is under Corporate Planning Organization will support driving GFP&A activities for the entire company. This position will involve analyzing and developing content for CFO, product groups, investor relations and treasury, and presenting that content in an effective way. The position requires high level of diligence as majority of the reporting and presentations will be serving the executive management of the company. This person will help summarize the data related to market trends and drivers, competitors, business unit financials in a meaningful way. This person will proactively work with key business partners across the company to develop actionable reports and analyses. The ideal candidate needs to be comfortable working on strategic initiatives, as well as deliverables related to financial reporting cadence. The right individual will have strong analytical skills and work ethics, capable of executing to deadlines and requests. Also the person should demonstrate solid grasp and understanding of financials and GAAP reporting, including understanding of balance sheet and cash flow statements and drivers. Primary Responsibilities: Interpret financial results into insights and recommendations for presentation to executives Perform regular predictive financial modeling, monitoring outcomes, and refining the model Act as a finance business partner and subject matter expert across the business Manage and update content as needed for investor relations events and board meetings Provide financial modeling, analysis, and valuation support for acquisitions and ad-hoc projects Identify and implement reporting of key financial metrics that enable meaningful insights and improve the visibility to company’s financial results Partner with GIS to enable implementation of reporting systems and processes across Finance Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree (Master’s Degree preferred) – Finance, Accounting, Economics or Business-related degree preferred 8-12 years of experience in Finance/Accounting for reputable firms Strong communication and persuasion skills Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, dashboards, data visualization Strong analytical, financial modeling and reporting skills Attention to details, ability to think clearly, work effectively with cross-functional teams. Curiosity to learn the business, improve processes and strive for excellence Ability to work with minimal guidance in a fast-paced, global environment Experience in implementing new finance technology such as Tableau, Big Data, etc. a plus Company Facts: Ticker: Nasdaq: AMAT Fiscal 2020 Revenue: $17.2 billion Fiscal 2020 R&D: $2.2 billion Founded: November 10, 1967 Headquarters: Santa Clara, California Global Presence: 110 locations in 19 countries Manufacturing: China, Germany, Israel, Italy, Singapore, Switzerland, Taiwan, United States Employees: ~24,000 worldwide Patents: ~14,300 issued Fortune World’s most admired companies 2021, Top 100 Barron’s most sustainable companies 2021 #LI Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobTitle: Sr. Manager – ML Ops, Data Engineering - (M5)
jobDescription: The Senior Manager will lead a team of engineers including software engineers, data engineers along with ML OPS engineers to create machine learning and data platform / solutions to provide best in class experience for our customers. Operate as a thought leader and visionary, with the ability to guide/architect/deliver an ML platform and influence across data science/engineering and analytical functions. This position will work with data scientist and engineers to build a platform to effectively train and operationalize algorithms and models. Key Responsibilities: Establish scalable, efficient processes for large scale data analysis, model development and model implementation. Ensure successful delivery of the products milestone. Develop the Feature engineering & ML/Ops roadmap using the most appropriate technologies, manage, and expand ML & data teams to support growth. Communicate with product management and engineering teams on problem definition and present findings in easily understood ways for efficient model building and deployment. Mentor and develop the technical and business skills of ML Ops and data engineers. Define best practices and articulate a clear vision for how data pipelines, ML pipelines should be done. Partners with the product team to help inform the priorities within a set of products, applications, and/or services Manages software engineers who design, build and maintain solutions within a set of technology products and/or services; oversees the translation of business requirements and functional specifications into logical program designs, code modules, stable application systems, and software solutions Ensures the alignment, buy-in, and support of diverse stakeholders by building and maintaining trusting relationships with internal customers, third-party vendors, and senior management Resolves escalated issues throughout the development, configuration, and modification of integrated business and/or enterprise application solutions Creates and/or leads the creation of SOPs, KPIs, and overall operationalization of assigned services or applications Hires, trains, and develops talent for growth opportunities; monitors team/individual’s morale and engagement to maintain highly effective and collaborative environments Responsible for the development, implementation, maintenance, support and scalability of robust, reliable and secure software solutions Minimum Qualifications: 10+ years of experience with 2+ years leadership experience, including experience leading data engineering and data analytics. Track record of successfully recruiting, developing and retaining top talent from leading organizations. Strong background and hands-on experience with software development in complex production-quality software in python and Java Experience with orchestration tools such as Airflow Comfortable with CI/CD Pipelines Experience with Git version control, and other software adjacent tools Comprehensive knowledge of data platform architecture, data modeling, database optimization, data management practices and processes. Strong understanding of agile software development principles. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science or equivalent. Master's degree preferred. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Senior Optical Process Engineer Applied Materials is shaping future tech trends by turning breakthrough ideas into reality. Our expertise in materials engineering is the foundation that computers, mobile devices and flat panel displays — products touched daily by billions of people all over the world — are built on. Join us and become a part of the next wave of engineering that makes possible AI/ML, big data, autonomous vehicles, AR/VR, IoT and more. In the Office of the CTO, we are focused on bringing Applied Materials innovations to new and adjacent markets. Our Engineered Optics team is creating new super thin (sub micron) optical surfaces based on nanometer-sized structures on transparent substrates (known as “metasurface based optics” or “flat optics”), which manipulate light in the deep sub wavelength domain and enable previously impossible capabilities. These components will be the most fundamental change in optics in hundreds of years and could be deployed in AR/VR devices, cameras, projectors, sensors, and a host of yet to be imagined opportunities — there is endless potential. Our dedicated and talented team is working to perfect this new technology. If you’re an entrepreneurial-oriented, enthusiastic Sr. Optical Process Engineer for back-end-of-line processes who is willing to learn and challenge yourself in creating cutting-edge technology to revolutionize the field of optics — we want you to be a part of our team. Key Responsibilities Process development for optical device backend production Metrology development for process monitoring and improvement Design, collect data, analyze and compile reports on a wide range of complex process engineering experiments for multiple products, within safety guidelines Utilize techniques to characterize hardware, define methods and apply new technologies to characterize hardware, and/or perform hardware characterization on a wide range of complex systems for multiple products, within safety guidelines Generate internal and external documentation for products, presentations, technical reports and generate process engineering specifications Develop, plan and execute process engineering projects, within safety guidelines Develop and mature processes that meet customer specs Interact with customers to resolve a wide range of complex process engineering issues/problems Design and implement new technology, products and analytical instrumentation Identify, select and work with vendors and suppliers Functional Knowledge Gage R&R and Statistical Process Control Data analysis using python / jmp / etc. Hands-on experiences setting up new equipment’s and processes Experiences in the following areas are a big plus: laser singulation, optical inspection, die bonding, micro- and nano-scale manufacturing. Business Expertise Interprets internal/external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services Leadership May lead functional teams or projects with moderate resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity Problem Solving Leads others to solve complex problems; uses sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions Impact Impacts the achievement of customer, operational, project or service objectives; work is guided by functional policies Interpersonal Skills Communicates difficult concepts and negotiates with others to adopt a different point of view #LI Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. Qualifications Education: Master's Degree: Engineering Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobTitle: SR SAP Supply Chain Solutions Management - (B5)
jobDescription: Key responsibilities: Serve as an interface with assigned business unit or functional area such as Sales, Operations, Engineering, Service and Finance for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution discovery, service management, project portfolio mgmt, and relationship management. Validates and ensures design integrity of business process/business application solutions to address complex cross functional needs. Oversee software application functional specification development and configuration for complex individual projects and/or across multiple, concurrent projects. Develops testing and data conversion strategies. Identifies and recommend industry BKM's for integrated solution design and standards, and develop and enforce defined standards; Keeps abreast of technologies in the market and drive new technology evaluations. Oversee business application functional support services to meet performance, availability, customer service level agreement and customer satisfaction targets. Ensure systems are monitored and tuned for availability and performance, and that rigorous root cause analysis is performed and preventative/corrective actions implemented. Oversees execution of application lifecycle activities. Plans and ensures delivery of project and support services within area of responsibility within allocated budget. Develops project budgets. Develops deep understanding cost model and cost drivers for service(s) and develops and implements service area budgets and cost optimization initiatives. Responsible for timely renewal of maintenance and subscription contracts. Monitors and ensures adherence to GIS project management, software application development, testing, service management, change management, RCA and other relevant processes, standards, governance and controls. May manage execution of sox controls and testing, and support internal and external audits. Plan and manage large scale, complex cross functional business application projects to ensure effective and efficient execution in line with guardrails of scope, timeline, budget and quality. Oversees contingent workers performing services across multiple projects or service areas. Ensures selection, on boarding and off boarding of contingent workers is performed in a timely manner. Ensures contingent workforce utilization is optimized. Works with management and strategic providers to identify gaps and opportunities and to recommend improvement plans. May approve contingent worker time sheets/costs. Functional Knowledge: Regarded as the technical expert in their particular field Demonstrates in-depth and/or breadth of expertise in own discipline and broad knowledge of other disciplines within the function. Business Expertise: Anticipates business and regulatory issues; recommends product, process or service improvements. Leadership: Leads projects with notable risk and complexity; develops the strategy for project execution. Problem Solving: Solves unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business; requires conceptual and innovative thinking to develop solutions. Impact: Impacts the direction and resource allocation for program, project or services; works within general functional policies and industry guidelines. Interpersonal Skills: Communicates complex ideas, anticipates potential objections and persuades others, often at senior levels, to adopt a different point of view. Experience Bachelor’s degree in computer science or Operations Research Over 15 years experience, with over 10 years in the implementing supply chain solutions Knowledge of supply chain processes in semiconductor industry preferred or deep supply chain process knowledge in related industry (heavy machinery, medical equipment) Experience in implementing SAP supply chain solutions a must - in semiconductor industry or related industry preferred Experience in new generation SAP supply chain products, like SPP, IBP a definite plus #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Key Responsibilities: Senior Technical Facilities position to provide technical leadership in space planning; semiconductor equipment installation feasibility & planning; facilities capacity tracking; CAD & BIM coordination; and facility as-built & point-of-connection update & revision control for multiple semiconductor or display equipment R&D lab facilities; Develop accurate layout, scope of work, cost estimate and schedule forecast for equipment install and other facilities projects; Execute 30% Design (Planning) for equipment install and other facilities projects; Manage facilities CAD database, mechanical and electrical point-of-connection and as-built; Collaborate with Business Units to identify future lab facility plans and requirements in order to meet Company product roadmap; Collaborate with Facilities Operations & Engineering to implement and refine facilities capacity model; Assume additional duties and projects as directed by management Functional Knowledge - In-depth knowledge and experience of Semiconductor R&D Facilities planning procedusres and processed In-depth knowledge of building, fire, safety, and cleanroom standards and codes Technical knowledge of the semiconductor manufacturing equipment and support equipment Working experience as a planning engineer, facilities engineer or design & construction engineer in semiconductor manufacturing (wafer fab) facilities a strong plus Working knowledge of Revit Architecture and MEP, BIM360, AutoCAD Architecture and MEP, Bluebeam and other related software Knowledge of semiconductor facilities systems including but not limited to acid waste and exhaust, solvent waste and exhaust, chilled/condenser water, hot water, process chilled water & DI water, process gases, controls, and monitoring systems Knowledge of Fire Life Safety and Gas Life Safety Systems and requirements Knowledge of City Permit requirements, National Electrical Code, Uniform Building Code, and Fire Codes Knowledge of Environmental & Safety regulations and requirements. Requires specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise. Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions. Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations. May lead functional teams or projects. Job Description Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s definition of Winning. This position will be the finance partner to support strategic initiatives within SPG. In this role, the candidate will be expected to apply conceptual and practical financial expertise to address complex business problems, and drive investment decisions for profitable growth. As a key finance business partner, the candidate will anticipate internal and/or external business challenges and actively influence management with critical analysis and sound business advice. This role collaborates with various cross-functional organizations globally and requires the ability to provide solutions to complex problems. Major Responsibilities Serve as a business consultant and primary finance / analytical support for SPG strategic initiatives including partnerships and inorganic activities Collaborate with business partners and develop business and financial scenario analysis to determine viability and feasibility of strategic programs, partnerships and inorganic initiatives Work with Operations and support SPG capital review and planning process Support management in completing other ad hoc projects and analysis Build and monitor business partner goals and budget throughout the year and manage quarterly reporting and forecasting Complete detailed analysis and commentary for finance and non-finance executives Partner with finance counterparts to drive and implement best practices for financial tools and processes for financial cycles and analytical tools Implement Agile / Digital processes together with extended team Key Expectations Proven competencies in communication, financial analysis and working across functions with different levels of management to drive results Eager to learn and understand the business to apply and establish standardized financial processes Influencing – ability to impact decision within own organization, cross functionally and within different level of management by leveraging experience and competencies in financial analysis Self-starter: able to maintain financial cycle deliverables, identify change and drive items to closure with limited management oversight Curiosity to understand the drivers of top and bottom-line growth Qualifications, Education & Experience BS degree in Accounting, Finance, or related area; MBA a plus 5-7 years relevant experience Very strong Excel skills, including modeling M&A experience a plus Interpersonal skills to engage with partners to understand key issues, develop recommendations and implement actions to improve the business result Analytical and problem-solving skills Basic accounting knowledge Data analysis tools such as Tableau or Power BI is a plus Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. If you are an experienced professional with a passion for semiconductor technology and hungry for driving change transformation at a global scale, you might be a fit for the Applied Materials Strategic Supplier Technology Group. This is a great opportunity to build and implement transformational supply chain strategies that optimizes technology creation & sustainability, affordability and velocity within supply chain to deliver significant impact for leading architectural elements. Applied Materials Strategic Supplier Technology Group (SSTG) team is looking for a Supply Chain Enabling Technologist to lead strategic sourcing, technology road mapping, industry enabling and related project execution of critical architectural elements within the semiconductor equipment. An SCET within the technology source development team is a thought leader responsible for developing make-buy Sourcing Strategies and clear action plans spanning various facets of make-buy decision including direct sourcing, capacity consignment, Investments, IP licensing, etc to drive differentiable and sustainable value creation and value preservation for Applied Materials and its critical stakeholders. In this position you will focus on leading internal engagements across Supply Chain, Engineering, IP & Legal, Applied Ventures while diving deep into the technologies and operations both from a Product and Supply Chain perspective. You will analyze trends involving the industry players – subcomponent vendors, customers and technology to develop strategies to reduce cost, minimize value leakage, utilize emerging and disruptive technologies, allowing Applied Materials to meet and exceed its business goals. SSTG SCET Responsibilities Derive sourcing roadmap from established technology roadmap within specific focus area (Process Power, Chemical Delivery or Specialty Materials (coatings, surface finishing etc)). Conduct comprehensive environmental scan (supplier ecosystem, competitive benchmarking) to determine right sourcing strategies to meet the technology roadmap. Develop multi-gen, make-buy supply chain program strategies and plans for a BU, department or project to satisfy internal clients Drive organizational alignment on prioritization of strategic projects working with the stakeholders Develop and maintain KPIs that are leading indicators of success of the strategic initiatives under taken. Driving the vision/strategy all the way down to the actual project management of large, strategic projects across Applied Materials supply chain. Quantify impact of strategic projects in terms of value created (market share, gross margin dollars etc) and frequently present to Senior Management Team to advocate and advance transformational strategies. Minimum Qualifications Master's/PhD degree in technical related field with at least 10 years of experience within Semiconductor fab/equipment industry 5+ years of experience leading large cross-functional supply chain transformational programs Preferred Qualifications MBA Functional knowledge of supply chain enabling models Subject matter expertise within the specific focus area (RF process Power, Chemical Delivery or Specialty Materials (coatings, surface finishing etc) in the context of focus area’s impact to on wafer performance. Experience establishing & maintaining KPIs to track and monitor performance and develop improvement plans Experience preparing process workflows and associated documentation Proven ability to influence others with experience communicating to and influencing senior leadership Excellent creative thinking skills with emphasis on developing innovative solutions to solve complex problems that may not have one clear answer Qualifications Education: Master's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
