The Opportunity Join the Materials Center of Excellence (MCOE) team, as a system engineer with a background in electrical engineering leading and assisting engineering efforts to evaluate new product ideas, new materials, new components and/or new processes that will be integral for the success of the next big product ideas for Applied Materials Silicon Product Group. You will be responsible for the design and integration of complex electromechanical assembly into product including system design, performance tradeoffs on system integration challenges. This is a highly visible role within the company with an emphasis on productization and execution from concept to volume production with end-to-end responsibility. The best candidate will be working side by side with engineering, productivity, supply chain, and operations to drive innovative material engineering solutions that bring value to our customers in device performance, yield, and cost of ownership. Character Passion for new technologies, innovation and finding solutions to impossible problems Persistent sense of urgency to learn quickly, fail fast and develop exciting new technologies faster than anyone else Out-of-the-box thinking. No hesitation recommending improved ways of doing things, and no fear recommending stopping a project that isn’t getting traction Motivation and commitment to take projects and tasks at hand to their conclusions Communicates complex ideas, anticipates potential objections, and persuades others, often at senior levels, to adopt a different point of view Responsibilities: What will you do Design or modify engineering assemblies, layouts, schematics and/or detailed drawings/specifications of difficult scope Support fundamental research, advanced development, as well as practical design and assessment efforts of complex systems using nonlinear, multi-physics analysis. Explore a range of complex electromagnetic behavior in ceramics, metal, and polymer composite assembly. Suggest best approaches to co-optimize electrical and thermal performance of complex electromechanical products Use static and transient models to create/develop methods to predict field failure models. Build simulation models by using verification, calibration, and validation techniques and best practices leading to high-quality results. Create solutions to manage the wafer bow with ceramic pedestals and chucks. Lead and/or assist in optimizing controls for new and existing ceramic and chucks. Technically lead and/or execute engineering projects, including development of key suppliers Perform and/or oversea wide range of electrical characterization of materials not limited to dielectric loss tangent, capacitance, impedance spectroscopy, deep level transient spectroscopy, etc Develop metrology hardware (and may develop software) to enable automated measurement of key performance metrics. Implement and/or enhance system diagnostics and calibrations. Validate through testing. Support system engineering projects that have a substantial mix of electrical, mechanical, physics, algorithms, and software design, and understand the underlying system implications Coordinate a wide variety of materials, samples, testing, assessing, reporting, etc. simultaneously across multiple technologies, programs, partners, suppliers, and customers Prepare summary reports for internal and external audiences, present findings, data, and conclusions to technical experts Drive the exploration, validation, and integration of technologies, materials, analysis methods, and tools to advance and expand team capabilities. Maintains relationships with outside customers of innovation, Universities, Consortia. Participates in technological customer engagements Hands on experience with designing, assembling, calibrating, and using complex opto-mechanical instrumentation or systems that incorporate light sources, optical sensors, lenses, filters, etc. Qualifications Thorough knowledge of electrical engineering analysis and design with proficiency in solving engineering problems using analytical techniques and engineering knowledge employing concepts of charge transport in materials, solid state physics, radio frequency, transmission line. Solid background in applied electrical and computational techniques to simulate 3D/2D electromagnetics. Extensive experience in modeling and various simulation tools (Ansys HFSS, Maxwell, ADS, COMSOL, RSOFT, MEEP). Preference will be given to candidate with multi-physics simulations experience. Proficiency in data analysis software like MATLAB, Python, Excel, or equivalent Understand control technology and capable of developing and implementing controls architecture. Preference will be giving to candidate with practical experience in sensing (eg capacitive, proximity, etc) for extreme temperatures Hands on experience with designing, assembling, calibrating, and using complex opto-mechanical instrumentation or systems that incorporate light sources, optical sensors, lenses, filters, etc CAD drawing tools not limited to Siemens Nx Unigraphics, Inventor, AutoCAD, etc. Modeling of electrical constrains for better design and material optimization. Assess the technical trade-offs compared to cost trade-offs for material solutions Working knowledge of PCB technology, connectors, cables, semiconductor packaging materials, and associated material and processes interactions Working knowledge of materials & components used in semiconductor wafer manufacturing equipment, materials characterization methods, and failure analysis of materials/system Education & Experience: MS with 6+ years of experience or PhD in Electrical Engineering with 4+ years of experience in electromagnetics, controls & sensing or charge transport in materials Research project or industry experience in design characterization and validation of sensing systems that includes theory of operation, signal processing, fabrication, packaging, and design trade – offs Demonstrated comfort managing fast-paced innovation utilizing external services, contractors, and specialists in an efficient, cost-effective manner Systems thinker with depth and breadth of expertise in an area. Preferred Qualifications Experience with design of and device/system manufacturing involving active piezo, anisotropic, non-linear materials and active devices (Eg MEMS) is preferred Working knowledge of analog/digital circuitry and power controls Experience with solid mechanics and thermodynamics is preferred Knowledge of computational materials discovery and screening is valuable but not essential Image processing and software automation experience a plus. Experience with supporting manufacturing and service organizations through training, documentation (procedures, OMS, BKMs, etc.), and troubleshooting. Experience working with ceramic or composite fabrication techniques such as milling, casting, sintering in vacuum furnaces, hot-presses, autoclaves #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. If you like to solve complex problems, design & troubleshoot hardware, and make equipment work better, this is the role for you. As a Systems Engineer, you’ll work in our state-of-the-art facility and at customer sites around the globe, where you are the face of Applied Materials and an integral part of a vibrant and diverse team. The ideal candidate will have related to the semiconductor industry. Additionally, expertise in the Etch Process, Material Science, and/or Defects is a plus. Our senior-level Systems Engineers work independently, to create and support the technology that the world relies on to manufacture semiconductor chips and related materials. You’ll work beside global customers to design, maintain and upgrade their Applied Materials equipment, delivering world-class products and support for multimillion-dollar production systems. Key Responsibilities Lead, develop, and execute complex projects that have a substantial mix of electrical, mechanical, physics, algorithms, and software design. Attend design reviews, provide input to meet market requirement specifications and hardware/software specifications. Ensure designs meet market requirement specifications. Coordinate with project marketing and management to understand system requirements. Be able to chair architecture brainstorming meetings and drive the systems process to down select to a final architecture of a top level system. Take a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions and solve complex problems. Drive resolution of key issues with Engineering and own beta site test plans and reporting. Write detailed specifications that cover all aspects of subsystem modules including interfaces to the product by using systems analysis to create a diagram. Create concepts for complex architectural design approaches. Lead team evaluations of architectures to provide recommendation for best system solution approach. Problem identification and troubleshooting a wide range of difficult, complex engineering problems. Interpret internal/external business issues and recommend best practices. Develop new procedures and Best Known Methods to service new products and contribute to the FMECA process. Ensure corrective actions and Lessons Learned are captured in new products design intent. Support System Integration during the assembly and final testing of new product designs. Interface with other groups to workout design, systems architecture development and integration issues. Define systems architecture, equipment interfaces, and insure they are up to date and documented. Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world. Our expertise in modifying materials at atomic levels and on an industrial scale enables customers to transform possibilities into reality. Our innovations make possible™ the technology shaping the future. To achieve this, we employ some of the best, brightest, and most talented people in the world who work together as part of a winning team. While virtually every nationality, culture, and background are currently represented within Applied Materials, we strive for a more robust Culture of Inclusion (COI) and diversity. Leveraging our COI vision helps drive innovation, build organizational capabilities, create equal opportunities for everyone, and achieve our company’s Definition of Winning. We’re building a brand new semiconductor processing chamber and need a strong team to accomplish this task under a tight timeline. We’re looking to hire someone with a strong electrical engineering background who has expanded their scope to encompass larger electro/mechanical/RF systems. Responsibilities Work with team to generate overall systems architecture and subsystem requirements to meet market needs. Create concepts for solutions meeting subsystem requirements. Lead team evaluations of concepts to provide recommendation for best solution based on performance, cost, lead time, etc. Guide electrical, software, and controls teams in converting subsystem concepts into designs. Select and work with suppliers to convert designs into hardware. Install, troubleshoot, and test newly designed hardware. Refine hardware/software/controls based on tested performance. Qualifications Degree in electrical engineering plus industry experience (10+ for bachelors, 4+ for PhD) Experience designing/troubleshooting RF circuits, including RF filters and matching networks. Prior knowledge of Beckhoff safety PLCs is a plus. Job Title: Systems Engineer II Senior Job Description The Systems Engineer will be responsible for project engineering for RF technologies, Electro-mechanical systems, and sensors. The candidate will be required to meet with project stake holders on a regular basis to understand technical issues and develop solutions. Key Responsibilities Support system engineering projects that have a substantial mix of electrical, mechanical, physics, algorithms, and software design, and understand the underlying system implications. Contribute to the system engineering specification within the field of one's expertise. Assist in creating the system engineering specification and write the portion of the system engineering specification pertaining to field of technical expertise. Perform and coordinate tests, and provide feedback to product engineering, physics, algorithms and software on new designs and ongoing engineering improvements. Problem identification and troubleshooting of moderately difficult engineering problems in field of technical expertise, including serviceability and manufacturability. Support System Integration during the assembly and final testing of new product designs. Ensure that all new designs of hardware and software meets the MRS, and are reliable, safe, user friendly and maintainable by the field. Assist in defining all external equipment interfaces, analyze architecture ideas and insure they are up to date and documented. Learn and begin contributing to the systems architecture development process. Troubleshoot a variety of moderately complex electrical problems Implement concepts for product issues and electrical solutions of moderate difficulty Assist in development of electrical product specifications Provide timely status updates and proactive communications on issues to the stakeholders. Functional Knowledge 7+ years of experience with a Bachelor of Engineering degree in Computer Science/ Electrical Engineering / Computer Engineering / Electronics / Electrical / Mechanical Engineering / Physics / Instrumentation is desirable. Experience in leading system architecture development, preferred. Ability to interpret schematics and proficiency in embedded hardware development. Knowledge in embedded software architecture and development. Knowledge and experience of Electromagnetic Magnetic principles preferred. Prior experience of working in global teams and interfacing with multiple stake holders. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written) and the ability to interact with extended teams spread across the globe. Explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus. Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 25% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

The Opportunity Join the Materials Center of Excellence (MCOE) team, as a system engineer with a background in mechanical engineering leading and assisting engineering efforts to evaluate new product ideas, new materials, new components and/or new processes that will be integral for the success of the next big product ideas for Applied Materials Silicon Product Group. You will be responsible for the design and integration of complex electromechanical assembly into product including system design, performance tradeoffs on system integration challenges. This is a highly visible role within the company with an emphasis on productization and execution from concept to volume production with end-to-end responsibility. The best candidate will be working side by side with engineering, productivity, supply chain, and operations to drive innovative material engineering solutions that bring value to our customers in device performance, yield, and cost of ownership. Character Passion for new technologies, innovation and finding solutions to impossible problems Persistent sense of urgency to learn quickly, fail fast and develop exciting new technologies faster than anyone else Out-of-the-box thinking. No hesitation recommending improved ways of doing things, and no fear recommending stopping a project that isn’t getting traction Motivation and commitment to take projects and tasks at hand to their conclusions Communicates complex ideas, anticipates potential objections and persuades others, often at senior levels, to adopt a different point of view Responsibilities: What will you do Design or modify engineering assemblies, layouts, schematics and/or detailed drawings/specifications of difficult scope Support fundamental research, advanced development, as well as practical design and assessment efforts of complex systems using nonlinear, multi-physics analysis. Explore a range of thermal, structural, and fluidic optimization algorithms to suggest the best approaches of complex electromechanical products Use static, dynamic, structural, and thermal-mechanical analysis, and create/develop methods to predict field failure models. Build simulation models by using verification, calibration, and validation techniques and best practices leading to high-quality results. Create optimal ceramic heater designs. Lead and/or assist in optimizing control systems for new and existing ceramic heaters Technically lead and/or execute engineering projects, including development of key suppliers Provides a broad mechanical engineering design background and performs mechanical engineering analysis using commercial CFD tools including flow, transient, plasma & thermal analysis. Support system engineering projects that have a substantial mix of electrical, mechanical, physics, algorithms, and software design, and understand the underlying system implications Develop metrology hardware (and may develop software) to enable automated measurement of key performance metrics. Implement and/or enhance system diagnostics and calibrations. Validate through testing. May be responsible for the design, development, and implementation of custom mechanical tooling, fixturing, and associated processes to enable the handling, assembly and/or disassembly of parts, components, sub-assemblies, and final assemblies throughout the product life cycle. Define and manage performance & reliability test plans for these new materials, processes, and components Coordinate a wide variety of materials, samples, testing, assessing, reporting, etc. simultaneously across multiple technologies, programs, partners, suppliers, and customers Prepare summary reports for internal and external audiences, present findings, data, and conclusions to technical experts Drive the exploration, validation, and integration of technologies, materials, analysis methods, and tools to advance and expand team capabilities. Maintains relationships with outside customers of innovation, Universities, Consortia. Participates in technological customer engagements Qualifications Thorough knowledge of mechanical engineering analysis and design, mechanics, and material science concepts and techniques, including proficiency in solving engineering problems using analytical techniques and engineering knowledge such as thermodynamics, measurement control, heat transfer, stress analysis, Finite Element Analysis, and system integration Hands-on experience in mechanical design in the areas of CAD drawings, thermal design, fluidic design, FEA, FMEA, etc. Experience in FEM modeling and various simulation tools (Ansys HFSS, Maxwell, ADS, COMSOL), CAD drawing tools not limited to Siemens Nx Unigraphics, Inventor, AutoCAD, etc Proficiency in data analysis software like MATLAB, Python, Excel, or equivalent Modeling of mechanical constrains for better design and material optimization. Assess the technical trade-offs compared to cost trade-offs for material solutions Working knowledge of materials & components used in semiconductor wafer manufacturing equipment, materials characterization methods, and failure analysis of materials/system Education & Experience: MS with 6+ years of experience or PhD in Mechanical Engineering with 4+ years of experience in materials (technical ceramics, electro ceramics, piezo, etc) or semiconductor devices or similar Research project or industry experience in design characterization and validation of extreme temperature systems (eg heaters, actuators, etc) that includes theory of operation, signal processing, fabrication, packaging, and design trade – offs Demonstrated comfort managing fast-paced innovation utilizing external services, contractors, and specialists in an efficient, cost-effective manner Systems thinker with depth and breadth of expertise in an area. Preferred Qualifications Experience with design of and device/system manufacturing involving active piezo, anisotropic, and non-linear materials and active devices (eg MEMS) is preferred Knowledge of computational materials discovery and screening is valuable but not essential Software automation and Image processing experience a plus Experience with optics and electromagnetics is preferred Demonstrated ability to drive technical projects with a multi-disciplinary team to completion. Experience with supporting manufacturing and service organizations through training, documentation (procedures, OMS, BKMs, etc.), and troubleshooting Experience working with ceramic or composite fabrication techniques such as milling, casting, sintering in vacuum furnaces, hot-presses, autoclaves #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Role Summary Applied Materials is seeking a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt who will be responsible for planning, coordinating, and executing continuous improvement projects & programs across a globally matrixed and cross-functional business environment. We are looking for a hands-on expert with strong technical competencies in continuous improvement, statistical toolset, DMAIC, and Lean. Key Responsibilities Drive Continuous Improvement methods to achieve breakthrough improvements in performance metrics in in manufacturing and transactional business areas. Understand data trends and drive quantified results by designing and deploying analytical systems and processes. Drive optimization of the Value Stream by elimination of waste and making flow improvements across or within manufacturing, field service and logistics operations. Facilitate groups through process mapping, root cause analysis, brainstorming and project planning. Lead Kaizen Events and LSS Black Belt level projects within and across operations to optimize performance. Coach and oversee successful completion of process improvement projects using LSS methodology. Train, mentor and coach Champions and Green Belts in the use of Six Sigma tools and methodology to ensure timely completion of projects with expected client results. Employ project management skills related to overall project tracking, deliverables management, action item tracking, meeting minutes, team communications, and presentations. Keep stakeholders apprised of project status and defined deliverables. Change agent responsible to drive Continuous Improvement projects in complex cross-functional environment. Comply with all IP guidelines, safety procedures and consistently demonstrates safety as a core value. Functional Knowledge Direct experience with demonstrated success and financial results leading Lean and Six Sigma projects in an operations or service environment. Deep understanding of problem solving methodologies including DMAIC, DFSS and Lean tools. Technical expertise of Six Sigma tools like Minitab, JMP, or other statiscatal packages Effective change agent and be adept in implementing change management principles across their projects Effective project management skills and ability to influence senior management. Functional understanding of core Logistics and Supply Chain functions. Business Expertise Utilize benchmarking to identify best practices, both internal and external to the organization. Comfortable presenting findings and recommendations to senior management. Semiconductor industry experience preferred. Logistics & Supply Chain experience preferred. Leadership Ability to lead and influence others within a matrix organization. Lead strategic projects while managing risk and resource requirements. Ability to effectively coach and mentor Process Owners, Champions and Green Belts. Resolves obstacles/roadblocks, serves as a sounding board for problem resolution. Impact Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies. Interpersonal Skills Explains difficult or sensitive information in an easy-to-understand manner; works to build consensus. Excellent interpersonal/communication and presentation skills. Adept at observing, assessing and helping team members recognize areas for development. Develops strong rapport with those they mentor. Qualifications Education Bachelor's Degree required (Engineering/ Manufacturing/Supply Chain/Logistics) Master’s Degree preferred Additional Qualifications Black Belt certification required Years Of Experience 7+ Years professional experience required 3+ Years of Continuous Improvement experience required 3+ Years’ experience in a related Logistics field required #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Key Responsibilities: Technical Facilities position to provide technical leadership in space planning; semiconductor equipment installation feasibility & planning; facilities capacity tracking; CAD & BIM coordination; and facility as-built & point-of-connection update & revision control for multiple semiconductor or display equipment R&D lab facilities BIM coordination – Develop and execute BIM strategy; set up, implement and maintain BIM standards, workflow and documentation Develop accurate layout, scope of work, cost estimate and schedule forecast for equipment install and other facilities projects Execute 30% Design (Planning) for equipment install and other facilities projects, Manage facilities CAD database, mechanical and electrical point-of-connection and as-built; Collaborate with Business Units to identify future lab facility plans and requirements in order to meet Company product roadmap; Collaborate with Facilities Operations & Engineering to implement and refine facilities capacity model; Assume additional duties and projects as directed by management Functional Knowledge In-depth knowledge and experience of Semiconductor R&D Facilities planning procedures and processes In-depth working knowledge in Revit Architecture and MEP, BIM360, AutoCAD Architecture and MEP, Bluebeam and other related software Working experience of BIM standards development & implementation, coordination with IT Department and BIM support for Architectural / MEP design In-depth knowledge of building, fire, safety, and cleanroom standards and codes Technical knowledge of the semiconductor manufacturing equipment and support equipment Working experience as a planning engineer, facilities engineer or design & construction engineer in semiconductor manufacturing (wafer fab) facilities a strong plus Knowledge of semiconductor facilities systems including but not limited to acid waste and exhaust, solvent waste and exhaust, chilled/condenser water, hot water, process chilled water & DI water, process gases, controls, and monitoring systems Knowledge of Fire Life Safety and Gas Life Safety Systems and requirements Knowledge of City Permit requirements, National Electrical Code, Uniform Building Code, and Fire Codes Knowledge of Environmental & Safety regulations and requirements. Knowledge of building control systems and remote energy management systems Strong analytical skills and knowledge of SPC, 8D, DMAIC, FMEA and other tools Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills Ability to work effectively as an individual with minimal direction, and as part of a larger multifunctional team Good team player in any environment; extensive experience using these skills to resolve differences amongst peers and stakeholders Highly proficient in Windows based software including Excel, Word, Project, Visio & PowerPoint; and familiarity with Cimplicity, TRIRIGA and MAXIMO Excellent written and verbal communication skills Business Expertise Interprets internal/external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes or services Leadership May lead functional teams or projects with moderate resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity Problem Solving Leads others to solve complex problems; uses sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions Impact Impacts the achievement of customer, operational, project or service objectives; work is guided by functional policies Interpersonal Skills Communicates difficult concepts and negotiates with others to adopt a different point of view Qualifications Education Bachelor of Science degree in an engineering discipline 7 to 10 years relevant working experience Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. jobTitle: Technical Facilities Engineer, Gas & Chemicals Specialist - (E4)
jobDescription: Description Requires specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise. Interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. Solves complex problems; takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions. Works independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations. May lead functional teams or projects. Key Responsibilities This is a Technical Facilities Engineer position. This position is to provide technical leadership in the planning, design, configuration, construction, commissioning, operations, and maintenance of gas and chemical (G&C) delivery equipment & systems. Job Responsibilities: Oversee the 24/7 operations, maintenance, and safety of all G&C delivery systems and ensure maximum uptime Monitor 3rd party maintenance providers performance and report Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) Respond to business interruptions or internal customer escalations Manage Gas & Chemical inventory and ordering Perform problem solving, troubleshooting, root cause analysis using 8D methodology Coordinate with multiple groups (planning, construction, safety, G&C service provider, building owners, management, etc.) to meet project or service request requirement and minimize system downtime and business interruptions Ensure that all G&C systems operate to design specifications Evaluate system capacities and capabilities and make improvement recommendations Forecast budget spending and review supplier invoices Identify and conceptually scope safety, compliance, capacity, redundancy, and cost savings projects Obtain funding and manage projects per scope, schedule & budget Review operation, maintenance, trouble shooting, project commissioning & acceptance, and other related documents for facilities systems; recommend and implement improvements Review and approve building construction, fit-up and tool hook-up designs Coordinate with 3rd party hazardous waste management service provider to ensure safe handling and disposal of gas, liquid and solid wastes Take various levels of responsibility for, and participation in the development of, project scope, budget, and schedule Provide technical direction to design engineers throughout the project conceptual design phase, interface with site user groups, other engineering disciplines, local municipalities and/or utilities, trade contractors, and other project stakeholders as required Develop effective process design deliverables to support all aspects of conceptual design Effectively interact with several internal engineering organizations to influence design standards, construction specifications, and operations requirements to ensure these enable construction to meet its Review and approve Chem Auth and MOC Functional Knowledge Demonstrates depth and/or breadth of expertise in own specialized discipline or field Business Expertise Interprets internal/external business challenges and recommends best practices to improve products, processes, or services Leadership May lead functional teams or projects with moderate resource requirements, risk, and/or complexity Problem Solving Leads others to solve complex problems; uses sophisticated analytical thought to exercise judgment and identify innovative solutions Impact Impacts the achievement of customer, operational, project or service objectives; work is guided by functional policies Interpersonal Skills Communicates difficult concepts and negotiates with others to adopt a different point of view Qualifications Education/Experience Bachelor of Science in Engineering degree in, but not limited to Mechanical / Chemical 7 years of high purity hazardous gas facilities management experience; or equivalent experience of more than 10 years of gas and chemical facilities management Prior Semiconductor experience is preferred and nice to have, but not a requirement Additional qualifications include: Working experience as facilities engineer in tech manufacturing Industrial gas and chemical delivery experience or equivalent Working knowledge of gas distribution system and PLC based controls systems Knowledge of local Fire, Building and Environmental codes Strong analytical skills and knowledge of SPC, 8D, DMAIC, FMEA and other tools Excellent written and verbal communication skills Foreign language capability a plus Experience with MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, AutoCAD, SCADA (e.g. GE Cimplicity), CAFM (e.g. IBM TRIRIGA), and CMMS (e.g.IBM Maximo) Ability to work effectively as an individual with minimal direction, and as part of a larger multi-functional team Working experience as facilities engineer in semiconductor manufacturing (wafer fab) facilities a strong plus Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 7 - 10 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Description A member of Applied’s IRMC team (Investor Relations, Public Relations and Marketing Communications functions), this individual is current in the major technology trends of the semiconductor and computing industries and uses their knowledge to help develop content that builds awareness and understanding of the value of Applied Materials to external audiences. Interfaces with technologists to generate materials for use in marketing/PR/IR activities, including product and technology presentations, and website content. Requirements Background in semiconductor technology: devices, process technologies, materials, and manufacturing. General understanding of the evolving markets for semiconductors, computing, and communications, including Internet of Things, electric/autonomous vehicles, and AI. Ability to understand complex technology concepts and translate them into high-level messaging that builds awareness and understanding among non-technical audiences. Strong writing and presentation creation skills with experience writing for technology industry journals, media publications and/or blogs a plus. Key Responsibilities Hand-on involvement in development of product-related marketing content, especially PowerPoint presentation materials. Contributes to the creation of unique and compelling story angles that align with strategic themes. Takes ownership of assigned projects, solving problems and completing deliverables with minimal guidance. Helps research and develop concepts for brand-compliant product naming, coordinates trademark process with internal groups. Prior Experience 6+ years of experience as a contributor of original content in addition to project leadership. Prior technical and/or product marketing experience. Experience in the semiconductor and/or computing and communications industries. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates familiarity with technical trends in semiconductors, technical understanding of semiconductor fabrication processes and equipment, and knowledge of the role of semiconductors in end products. Applies these capabilities to interactions with internal groups and others to fulfill responsibilities with minimal guidance. Is fully conversant with commonly used office software. Graphics software experience a bonus. Business Expertise Interpersonal Skills Demonstrates excellent presentation, writing, and story-telling skills (samples required). Excellent written and oral skills. Understands the role of a service group within an organization and applies this perspective to interactions with served groups while adhering to corporate guidelines and policies. Ability to achieve consensus among diverse individuals or groups. Qualifications Education: Degree in Physical Sciences (Chemistry/Physics/Materials Science) preferred, with technical marketing experience in the semiconductor industry a plus. Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce, including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities. #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Relocation Eligible: No Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Key Responsibilities Responsible for all technical support related aspects at a specific customer: escalations, fleet performance, system installations, improvement programs and upgrades. Acts as intermediary and field escalation focal point between customer and Division by providing technical support and documentation to field engineers, technicians and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing and debugging equipment. Provides Alpha Site support to Engineering specifically related to installation, operation, calibration, service and /or testing of a new hardware, process or software design in house or on an engineering tool Provides Beta Site Support; specifically related to installation, operation, calibration, service and/or testing of a new hardware, software or processes on a customer tool. Initiates and provides review of ECO's to ensure data supports fix and follow up with communication to the field. Generates and presents system performance data as required. This includes performance metrics such as MTBF, MTBI and Availability. Reporting will also include process data and I/W spending analysis. Supports GPS in the generation of documentation such as CENs and BKMs. Creates and reviews documentation covering technical improvements, system upgrades, and support plans. Presents at customer level. Ensures field implementation. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates conceptual and practical expertise in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines Business Expertise Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Leadership Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience; may lead small projects with manageable risks and resource requirements Problem Solving Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Impact Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies Interpersonal Skills Explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 10% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Solves a range of straightforward problems. Analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures. Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction. Key Responsibilities Helps to prepare project plan and coordinates project activities from planning to implementation. Maintain matrix for process improvements. Coordinates project schedule and task details and helps to prepare reports, tracking charts, checklist and project scheduling. Helps to align the progress of resources internal to the business unit to meet project on-time and budget performance objectives. Tracks projects cost schedule for internal and external customers. On occasion will interface with external suppliers and monitor and report on the projects progress against quality and cost metrics. Interfaces with internal customers and reports on progress against project objectives. General Profile: Recognized as an external thought leader within a strategic function or discipline. Influences the strategy to address internal or external business issues and needs. Proactively identifies and solves the most complex problems that impact the management and direction of the business. Participate in the development of the product or business strategy. Leads multidisciplinary projects or initiatives. Progression to this level is typically restricted on the basis of individual capabilities and business requirements. Key Responsibilities Technical program design expert providing oversight from conception and planning to implementation, including strategies, processes and resources. Ensures objectives are clearly defined and agreed to across the division in accordance with program budgets and release schedules. Responsible for managing long range schedule and task details by utilizing project management tools such as reports, tracking charts, checklist and project scheduling software. Works with senior business group management team to ensure that such programs, strategies, and processes are aligned with the business unit’s direction. Leads multifunctional design teams comprised of internal, external and/or matrixed headcount to complete project/program on time. Provides technical leadership to team members to achieve complex goals. Interfaces and coordinates with business unit senior management to define program objectives, provide status updates and prepare for release and deployment. Works closely with Engineering in the development of procedures and documentation for NPI. May serve as a "Quality Lead". Applied Materials is the leading semiconductor and display manufacturing company in the world…we Make Possible. World class IT department that drives change within the business and is recognized globally as an innovator and pioneer. Lead financial oversight of the wireless carrier services supporting the enterprise of 30,000+ employees while bringing latest mobile technology (Apple/Samsung, etc…) to empower our workforce. It requires familiarity with telecom expense and contract management practices for carrier based voice, data, and cellular services as well as telecom lifecycle vendor management. KEY REQUIREMENT: Advanced Excel and/or Tableau skills (large data file manipulation, vlookup, pivot tables, etc…) In this position the candidate initiates and manages complex wireless billing audits, defines wireless optimization recommendations, conducts vendor contract analysis, benchmarks wireless rates, ensures quality control, and performs inventory management. In addition, supports the end-to-end billing process, including all related end user billing inquiries and performs workflow through a ticketing system. The position requires strong problem-solving, analytical, verbal and written communication skills, as well as having demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively with wireless providers and inspire action and problem resolution. This is a high-volume transaction environment that requires great attention to detail and superior analytical skills. Responsibilities Manage telecom lifecycle including measuring, monitoring and analyzing carrier and TEM vendor performance against established Service Level Agreements and Key Performance Indicators Manage TEM software to maintain accurate records of: cellular services, inventory, accounts, and invoices Perform telecom vendor invoice review to ensure adherence to Contract or Statement of Work on a monthly or quarterly basis as indicated Supervise and analyze wireless invoices across multiple carriers including: audits, disputes, adjustments, allocations, approvals and payment Interface regularly with wireless services providers to resolve issues, gather information, and manage account activities/performance Identify opportunities to leverage vendor capacity and other efficiencies to reduce overall operational cost Validate identified billing disputes and cost savings opportunities through historical review, telecom vendor and customer contact while providing regular management reports Daily operational tracking related to billing and associated controls to verify data integrity to eliminate billing errors, including investigation and resolution of any variances Assist with the creation and testing of new reporting processes to improve process workflows Act as an information resource for internal employees, responding to and resolving inquiries concerning billing questions Build and maintain good working relationships with other departments and ensure constant communication on statuses, issues and deadlines Prepare ad hoc reports on an as needed basis Ensure quality control visibility by providing metrics reporting Process Wireless day-to-day help tickets through to resolution Provision devices with the correct rate plans and features for supported wireless devices, troubleshoots user issues and provides functionality instructions to users as needed Desired Skills and Experience: Minimum of three years' experience in Wireless Expense Management Strong understanding of AT&T, Verizon, Sprint, T-Mobile billing terminology, concepts and practices including services, taxes, fees, and contractual terms Demonstrated business acumen and the ability to apply financial expertise to telecom contracts and invoices Knowledge and understanding of financial oversight and management including billing, accruals, allocations, budgeting, and forecasting Experience working with a case/ticket management system (ServiceNow preferred) Ability to analyze, troubleshoot iOS devices and resolve issues of varying complexity with minimal supervision Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and work load to ensure all deliverables and expectations are met or exceeded Ability to effectively work cross functionally with carrier vendors, key users, other organizations and finance Must possess the ability to systematically push the carrier for results and to recognize when issues need to be escalated to the next level Ability to gather and analyze customer information from carrier portals and account reps in order to provide resolution and/or make recommendations Ability to develop presentation level graphics that illustrate and emphasize the business issue, both historical and trend Advanced Excel skills (vlookup, pivot table, etc…) Intermediate to advanced SQL, PowerPoint skills Excellent customer service skills Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English Extreme attention to detail, data accuracy quality of output and a strong ability to multi-task Superior analytical, decision-making and problem-solving skills International billing experience #LI Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree Skills Certifications: Languages: Years of Experience: 4 - 7 Years Work Experience: Additional Information Travel: Yes, 20% of the Time Relocation Eligible: Yes Applied Materials is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.

As a Quality Engineer in the AMAT Implant Business Unit Organization you will work in an environment where you will be part of a team that develops and implements inspection and test processes used to evaluate components and assemblies manufactured by suppliers for use in our products. You will work with AMT design, quality and production personnel along with supplier personnel to ensure that these processes are robust and that these components / assemblies consistently meet specifications. You will be responsible for evaluating material that fails to meet performance requirements in our products and implementing improvements to the inspection / test process in order to avoid future non-conformances. Key Responsibilities Member of Implant BU Incoming Electrical Inspection/Test Team that inspects and tests products provided by VSE Supply Base. Evaluates and modifies test procedures, equipment and software to comply with product design changes. Enhances test protocol to prevent recurrence of manufacturing DMRs and field NCs. Develops and applies quality standards in accordance with company and customer requirements. Designs and implements methods and procedures for inspecting, testing, and evaluating the precision and accuracy of products and/ or production equipment. Develops methods and parameters, project methodology and/ or project proposals. Develops and uses procedures. Prepares documentation for inspection/ testing procedures. Recommends corrective action for procedural, product, or process deficiencies. Analyze operational data; Develop and implement recommendations. Participates in and may lead audits. Evaluates work methods, procedures and policies. Tracks progress of qualification status, reviews reliability test results, determines disposition of non-compliant products, reviews and releases qualification packs Utilizes drawings, specifications, industry standards, and sketches, adapting inspection measuring devices and procedures when necessary. Read and interpret technical drawings and specification requirements. Reduces qualification cycle time and cost while still meeting quality performance requirements. Functional Knowledge Demonstrates conceptual and practical expertise in own discipline and basic knowledge of related disciplines Works independently, receives guidance in only moderately complex situations. Business Expertise Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of the competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market Has strong computer skills including programming experience with LabView or equivalent Knowledge & experience in Semiconductor Industry a plus Leadership Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience; may lead small projects with manageable risks and resource requirements Problem Solving Solves complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information Impact Impacts a range of customer, operational, project or service activities within own team and other related teams; works within broad guidelines and policies Interpersonal Skills Explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus Key point- Test development & LabView Programming experience needed. jobTitle: Wknd CNC Programmer (Machinist) Friday to Sunday 6AM-6:30PM
jobDescription: Key Responsibilities Can safely operate a CNC Mill or CNC Lathe performing moderately complex operations in producing prototype parts, production parts, modifications and repairs to existing parts and assemblies, and/or fabricating parts from steels, stainless steels, aluminum, plastics and other non-metals. Supports in-house customers, such as manufacturing, engineering, business units, direct/indirect materials, and facilities. Portrays a customer service approach. Interfaces effectively and courteously with customers. Utilizes Work Orders, blueprints, sketches, written and verbal instructions to determine machining process, procedures, tooling and fixtures requirements. Performs a variety of machining and/or assembly tasks utilizing standard machine shop equipment, such as surface grinders, drill presses, grinders, sanders, band saws, rotary table, and/or standard band and power tools. Plans and performs moderately complex machine set-ups. Possesses a basic knowledge of trigonometry, which is required to accurately calculate angles used in set-ups and machining. Makes full use of machine capacity to minimize amount of machining or number of set-ups required to product parts competitively. Performs machining operations, such as milling, turning, facing, boring, chasing single and multiple external and internal threads, drilling, grooving, reaming and chamfering. Monitor machines and verify that part dimensions conform to specifications. Performs visual and dimensional inspections to verify compliance with specifications. Uses calipers, micrometers, gauges, indicators, and other inspection tools. Performs rework as necessary. Maintains cleanliness of the work area and ensures proper handling of tools, equipment, and stock to prevent loss. Conforms to departmental safety requirements.
